I recently purchased the Boat BassHeads 162 earphones after hearing many positive reviews about its powerful bass and affordable price. As an avid music lover, I was eager to test them out and see if they lived up to the hype. After using them extensively for several weeks, I can confidently say that the Boat BassHeads 162 earphones offer an impressive audio experience at a budget-friendly price.Design and Build Quality:The Boat BassHeads 162 earphones feature a stylish and minimalist design. The earbuds are ergonomically shaped, making them comfortable to wear for extended periods. The cable is sturdy and tangle-resistant, which is a huge plus for everyday use. The overall build quality feels durable, and the earphones appear to withstand moderate wear and tear.Audio Quality:The highlight of the Boat BassHeads 162 is undoubtedly its bass performance. The earphones deliver deep and punchy bass, which is fantastic for bass enthusiasts and those who enjoy genres like EDM, hip-hop, and pop. However, it's worth mentioning that the bass can sometimes overpower the mids and highs, causing a slight imbalance in the overall sound signature. Nonetheless, for bass lovers, this might not be much of an issue.The midrange is generally clear and decently detailed, while the highs could be crisper. Audiophiles may find the treble to be slightly subdued, but for most casual listeners, this won't be a major drawback. Overall, the audio quality is more than satisfactory, considering the price range.Noise Isolation:The Boat BassHeads 162 earphones come with passive noise isolation, which does a decent job of blocking out external noise. It helps create a more immersive listening experience, especially in noisy environments like public transport or busy streets.Comfort and Fit:As mentioned earlier, the earphones are designed to fit comfortably in the ears. The package includes different sizes of ear tips, allowing users to find the perfect fit for their ears. I found them comfortable even during long listening sessions, and they stay securely in place during physical activities like jogging or working out.Microphone and Controls:The built-in microphone works well for calls, delivering clear voice transmission. The in-line controls are easy to use, allowing you to adjust the volume, skip tracks, and answer calls conveniently without reaching for your phone.Conclusion:The Boat BassHeads 162 earphones provide excellent value for their price. The powerful bass response, comfortable fit, and durable build make them a great choice for budget-conscious music enthusiasts. While the sound signature might not suit everyone's preferences, especially those seeking a more balanced audio experience, the BassHeads 162 still delivers an enjoyable listening journey, especially for bass lovers. If you are on a tight budget and looking for earphones with a focus on bass, the Boat BassHeads 162 is definitely worth considering.

QR code to download the User manual has been provided. There is a gross mismatch between user manual and product page in Amazon website.(1) According to the user manual this headphone supports BlueTooth 5.3 (which the latest version). But this Amazon product web site says BT4.2.(2) According to user manual battery lasts up to 60 hours. But as per product page, it is 9 hours only.(3) User Manual says "Type C charging port". But actually it is Type B charging port. Type A to Type B charging cable is provided in the box.(4) Net weight 142 grams as per User Manual. Amazon product page says 270 grams, which is almost double. It is really light weight. I don't even feel that it is on my head.Apart from the above mismatches in the features mentioned in the User Manual vs Amazon product page, I have only one thing to complain about - Corners of all plastic pieces on this headphone are too sharp. They could have been rounded for more handling comfort.I got this product for just below Rs. 500.* Look and feel are good.* Battery got fully charged within one hour when I charged it for the first time. I have used for nearly 12 hours and still there is 70% charge left (checked it thru my mobile phone). At this rate, it can give about 40 hours on full charge.* I am connecting it to my TV and watching movies. When I get phone calls, notifications are coming on the phone, that means connecting to two devices at the same time!* FM radio is working nicely.* BT connectivity is good.* Light weight and comfortable enough on the head.* Head band is provided with padding. Hand band is extendable.Getting over the ear headphones at this price is really great. Removable audio jack is another good feature of this low priced BT headphone.We can not get a budget headphones better than this.Noise cancellation, Hi-fidelity sound, extreme comfort, rotating ear cups, etc. are features that we can expect only in headphones priced over Rs. 4,000

In short, it should only be considered as a wired headset, because the Bluetooth function isn't upto mark.You get Aux Cable with 3.5mm connectors on both end and a Charging cable with USB to Micro USB connector.It charges up pretty fast, say in an hour or so. But there's no indicator when charging is completed, it's red when charging but when full, it's still red. You have to switch on or off or unplug and replug to know charging condition.In wired mode, the sound in muffled. Microphone doesn't work in wired mode.In Bluetooth mode, connection gets distorted every few seconds, but it's not repetative, but quite random. Sometimes there's a pause every 20 seconds, sometimes every 15 seconds and so on. That's the biggest drawback.Also, Bluetooth feature gets distortion and at times completely disconnects from any device if there's much movement, like brisk walking, climbing stairs. You'll have to maintain a standard cable length distance from device when using this headset in bluetooth mode, or else distortion is inevitable.It's made of Plastic, and the headset adjustment area(the place which slides down or goes up to adjust to your head size) is sloppy. It's made of plastic grooves and after 2-3 adjustment, the headsets starts sliding down on its own weight.That's another drawback.I replaced the product to check if these drawbacks were isolated incidents but to my surprise, they weren't. The replacement headset had the same problems.This is not a noise cancelling headset, but by design, headset earcups are supposed to cover our ears, hence a false notion of noise cancellation by default. But active Noise cancellation and Environmental Noise cancellation are completely different things. This headset has none of those, but if your ears are small, then the headset cups are gonna completely cover them and give a false hope of noise cancellation.The only plus point of this headset is the Aux port and it's price, which is quite economical.

I recently got my hands on the Ptron Bassbuds, and I must say, they have been quite a pleasant surprise. As a budget-conscious consumer, I was initially skeptical about their performance, but after putting them to the test, I'm impressed with what they offer for the price.Sound Quality: The standout feature of the Ptron Bassbuds is their audio quality. The bass response is punchy and powerful, as the name suggests. For bass enthusiasts, these earbuds won't disappoint. However, the bass isn't overpowering and still maintains a good balance with the mids and highs. The overall sound signature leans towards warmth, which makes them ideal for genres like pop, hip-hop, and electronic music.Design and Comfort: The design of the Ptron Bassbuds is sleek and compact, with a glossy finish that gives them a premium appearance. The earbuds fit snugly in my ears and come with multiple ear tip sizes, ensuring a comfortable fit for extended use. I appreciate the inclusion of touch controls, which are intuitive and responsive for managing playback, volume, and calls without reaching for my device.Battery Life: The battery life on the Ptron Bassbuds is quite impressive. On a full charge, I was able to get around 4.5 to 5 hours of continuous playback, and the charging case provided an additional 20 hours, which is more than enough for my daily needs. The USB Type-C charging port is a welcomed addition for quicker and hassle-free charging.Connectivity: Pairing the Bassbuds with my smartphone was effortless, and they maintained a stable connection with minimal dropouts during use.Call Quality: While the sound quality for music playback is excellent, the call quality on the Ptron Bassbuds is average. Callers on the other end reported my voice to be slightly muffled, and the built-in microphone didn't provide the best noise isolation in noisy environments.Final Thoughts: The Ptron Bassbuds offer exceptional value for money, providing an impressive audio experience at a budget-friendly price point. They excel in bass reproduction, making them a great choice for bass lovers. The design, comfort, and battery life are commendable, and the inclusion of touch controls is a definite plus. While the call quality could be improved, it's not a deal-breaker considering the overall package.If you're on a budget and seeking a pair of wireless earbuds that deliver on sound performance and functionality, the Ptron Bassbuds are an excellent choice

Right now I'm using this earbuds for around 20 days and the sound is very satisfactory. The bass and treble is quite clear and I think the sound quality is really good for the price. But there's only one single flaw in this device which is the latency. While gaming I almost hear sounds after like 55ms which is apparently equivalent to 1 second almost. The packaging says they provide a latency of 40 ms but it's not even close to 40. Hence the earbuds is a big no no for multiplayer games where sound is a key factor. Overall the conclusion is phantom 700 is good for music and casual gaming.

I am using wings phatom 340 since from 2months and the experience behind this earbuds is fantastic.Sound Quality: A good pair of earbuds should deliver clear, balanced audio with good bass response, clear mids, and detailed highs. Look for earbuds with high-quality drivers and possibly support for advanced audio codecs like AAC and aptX for improved wireless audio quality.Comfort and Fit: Comfortable earbuds are essential, especially if you plan to use them for extended periods. Look for models that come with different ear tip sizes or ear wings to ensure a secure and snug fit for your ears.Battery Life: Long battery life is crucial for uninterrupted listening. Look for earbuds that offer several hours of playback on a single charge, and a case that provides extra charges on the go.Connectivity: For wireless earbuds, consider the Bluetooth version and its range. Wire earphones, also known as wired earphones or headphones, are a popular choice for many people due to their affordability, reliability, and compatibility with various devices. Here are some key aspects to consider when evaluating wire earphones:1. Sound Quality: The sound quality of wire earphones can vary depending on the brand and price range. Generally, they offer good audio performance with clear and balanced sound reproduction. Higher-end models may provide enhanced bass response and better overall audio fidelity.2. Comfort and Fit: The comfort and fit of wire earphones are subjective and depend on individual preferences. Some earphone models come with different sizes of ear tips or additional accessories to ensure a secure and comfortable fit. It's important to find a pair that suits your ears well to minimize discomfort during extended use.3. Durability: Wire earphones are generally more durable compared to their wireless counterparts since they don't have delicate electronic components like batteries or Bluetooth modules. However, the quality of materials used and build construction can still affect their longevity. Look for earphones with reinforced cables and sturdy connectors to ensure they can withstand daily wear and tear.4. Noise Isolation: Some wire earphones offer passive noise isolation by creating a seal in the ear canal, blocking out external sounds. This can enhance your listening experience, especially in noisy environments. Keep in mind that the level of noise isolation can vary between models.5. Connectivity: Wire earphones typically use a 3.5mm audio jack, making them compatible with a wide range of devices such as smartphones, tablets, laptops, and audio players. However, it's important to check if your device still has a 3.5mm audio jack, as some newer smartphones have transitioned to wireless or USB-C audio connections.When choosing wire earphones, it's recommended to read customer reviews, compare different models, and consider your personal preferences and budget.

Dual connectivity works well, but is more like a pain to me. If I am in a meeting 9n my laptop, and my phone rings:2a. Automatically my meeting goes on hold and headset gets connected to phone. Now, that I am not interested to take the calls, I disconnect it and then it connects back to laptop, but I lost the conversation... There should be an option to set the priority device in the app.2b. Even worse - when I disconnect the phone, and connect back to meeting, the other person says that my voice is not clear and there is a background noise. So, I have to drop the meeting and join again.KiFor this reason only, I disconnected my headphone from mobile's calls. But then that means this feature is waste and of no use!Finally, I am thinking to sell it and buy Jabra

The microphone is touted to be "near boom quality" by Bose, but no such thing when using Bluetooth on a Macbook Pro (2022 model). It sounds digitally processed, thin, almost unrecognizable from oneself. Reportedly, this is due to a limitation of the Bluetooth spec. This would be fine if the included cable carried microphone output to get around this limitation, but in wired mode the mic is disabled, leaving Bluetooth as the only option for calls. The Macbook's built in mic is vastly superior, so you can switch the input source to the Macbook or another mic (I tried a lavalier also) while using the headset for audio output, but in this configuration the built in feature to hear oneself referenced in the headset is disabled, resulting in your voice sounding muffled and inside your head. Treat this headset as primarily for audio and only sometimes for laptop calls... otherwise, check out the JBL Quantum 100 + Rode AI-Micro for the best headset mic and direct mic referencing in combination.

Astounding noise cancellation, beautiful design and poor quality software support.1. The noise cancellation is unrivalled. A truly worthy competitor in this field. Compare it with the world‚Äôs topmost racing cars in the field of noise cancellation.2. It looks and feels like a piece of modern art. If you have an eye for sleek design, minimalism and ‚Äúless is more‚Äù thought process, you would appreciate these. Pitch it against any other headphone in the market side by side, and you could see the difference in build quality and design superiority.3. Software. Bose should fire at least half of its software engineering people. Looks like Bose doesn‚Äôt quiet really know what Quality Software means in 2021. Buggy iOS app, pathetic support site etc. it looks like Bose spent a ton of money in hiring top notch UI/UX designers and cut corners by hiring stupid and cheap app developers. The can‚Äôt be said to be reliable at all. It looks like force fit component in an otherwise beautiful and rock solid product which is worthy of being put at MOMA (Museum of Modern Art). I am guessing Bose relies heavily on third party software developers who don‚Äôt have any idea of what a ‚ÄúBose‚Äù product really means and who the ‚ÄúBose‚Äù people are. In all, software is a huge let down.4. Innovation and features. The world has made major technological advancements extremely fast and Bose seems still locked in its own research labs and in their ivory towers. Why Bose? Why the attitude? Why are you not adopting the best codecs available out there? Who says you have to clutter your product? Look at Sony and Apple and learn from their best success. Don‚Äôt think that you can remain hidden in your own research labs and can do all the innovation yourself. Because, a day might come, you will be paying a heavy price for this. If you don‚Äôt innovate and compete, you will die.Summary:This product would have been an undisputed leader 3 years ago, but not right now. Sorry Bose, others like Sony and Apple have worked very very hard and they deserve the respect and the market a bit more than you for this product.

Edit:I‚Äôve got a replacement (chose a black one this time) after mailing Servify and attaching them my chats with US Bose Support where the support staff indicated they replace products with this defect in the US and India.Build Quality: [Refer pictures]This is what the headset looks like after about 6 months of use, the color is fading, the cushions are torn and the stems creaks every time I take a step. Mind you, I've never even taken the headset on jogs, or under the sun and I dutifully replace these in the case after use.Service Center:For the company handling the service in India (Servify), none of these qualify as issues. I was asked to mail Bose USA or tag them on Twitter to get a response. After spending a quarter of a lakh on the device, I'd have expected much, much better resolutions. In the US, the color fading issue qualifies for a complete replacement. Why this double standard for Indian customer for whom the cost is much dearer?Bluetooth:The connectivity isn't that bad, but isn't great either. When you connect two devices at the same time, you get a lot of sync issues when listening to audio.Voice calls:This is what I bought this for and its microphones are THE BEST. Coming from AirPods Pro (which picks up everything from the street dog to cosmic microwave background radiation) this was a true revelation to use. My friends finally stopped complaining about the incessant barking and my drowned out voice. The ANC isn't perfect, but it works for most mildly loud environments.Sound:Even the songs you've heard for decades will sound new in these. These bring to center stage even the most feeblest of sounds and sets apart those composers who put their heart and soul into how their songs sound.Buy this if you want a balanced sound and great call quality, but won't worry if you hear the hinges creak and the color fade as fast as this device arrives.

Software Issues:So I bought these headphones in Jan this year and initially faced many issues regarding connectivity, as it was painful to switch between two devices, but as I knew beforehand so I made peace with it, but trust me its an understatement that the software is bad, its almost unusable on bad days,Anyway, I made peace with it as I bought them for Active NC, and that's the best part, Bose got at least one thing right thank god.Hardware Issues(on my unit):So they worked fine for a couple of months and then I started having issues with the charging port, it sometimes worked other times it won't work it was a hit or miss, but after about 1.5 months ago it stopped working completely,Customer Support:so I contacted their customer care to report the issue and get them fixed, it was easy to contact them but they were untrained professionals who didn't even know the model number and were not able to understand the issue, after much effort I got them to register my complain and that's when the frustrating part begins, they just registered my complain and didn't do anything about it, I called again and they said they are looking into the issue and I will get a call from them, waited one week for that then called again and they said I have visited or to send the my headphones to their service center, luckily I was able to convince them to pickup the device themself which took another week and 3-4 phone calls as again they seem to forget about it.its been more than 3 weeks now that they have got the device but customer support don't have any clue now as to what is happening, they just say I have to contact the service center for further info, the service center manager was nice and updated me that headphone will be replaced with new ones as they were under warranty, but again she didn't know when will they receive the replacement and said I have to talk to customer care to get them delivered to my house which I know will take more than 1 week again and that if she receives headphones.Let's see what happens, I may update this review after I get my replacement headphones.TLDR: really bad user experience when connecting multiple devices, horrible customer support.ps: if you like Bass-heavy music or good software experience go with Sony, If you like the best ANC with the best microphones and crisp music go with Bose.

For windows and android users, 90% WONT work "properly".For mac and ios users, 80% will/might work properly.Very disappointed with this product overall.Sound quality- Just like any other previous bose headphones. Nothing extraordinary considering the price. However due to the improvement in noise cancellation you might hear the audio a bit more clearer.Should have kept my 8 year old reliable QC15.I bought my first pair and returned and got it replaced with a new one because when I connected to my windows laptop (Dell XPS 15 9560), random stuttering/hiccups/cracking sounds came up when listening to almost anything. However, it worked seamlessly with my iphone 8 and macbook air (mid 2012 model). Tried couple of times calling Bose India support, no one picked up. Spoke to the amazon customer care advisor and he told me that this is not compatible with other OS systems other than Apple. But I was not convinced because Bose didnt mention anything about that in their website and also from tech reviewers, who reviewed it using windows and android OSs. I asked for a replacement and finally got a new pair today.Unfortunately, it is far worse than the previous pair. Infact, it not only has the random stuttering/hiccups/cracking sounds (For windows), but also a weird hissing sound from the left ear cup which makes my left ear painful (For both windows and mac). Please bare in mind that I tried all troublshooting methods which were discussed in the Bose community forums and nothing worked. Now I have to return it without any replacement because amazon can only replace this product once which is a shame.I bought this for 29,741rs on the 16th of October 2020 and now it costs 29,999, which means if I want to try it again, then i have to spend extra 258 rs and if that has another problem, then again replacement and maybe return.Honestly, this is by far the worst Bose product that I have ever bought. Extremely sad and very disappointed with Bose considering the premium price for this product.Both these pairs that I received, were manufactured in December 2019 and I bought this during the ongoing Amazon great Indian festival period (October 16th 2020). I dont know whether these problems have anything to do with the manufacturing year.So, if You are considering this headphones, please be prepared for a long ride with its issues if you are an unfortunate one like me.I must say that I literally fell in love with its design and also, my mate has the same headphones which works seamlessly on his iphone 11 pro max and on his windows laptop (Acer). He convinced me to buy this, but I was very unlucky, although, I wouldnt blame him either. I reseached about the problems I faced with the nc 700s and I found many people were unhappy with it especially after a month's use or a year's use. So dear folks, be careful when you choose this product and dont fall in love blindly with its design.I have to return it anyway. Planning to try QC 35 2.I hope this review helps.All the very best.

I haven‚Äôt faced any audio quality issues in about 1 months. The sound quality for music is amazing. I get it that for NC it has to form a tight fit around the ears and hence maybe unavoidableThe foam is pretty soft. Not sure how long it will last.Overall happy with the product and recommended

Pros -- Call quality is excellent plus it cuts off ambient noise while you are talking which is great. So if you are into taking lot of calls then this is the perfect choice as it keeps you focused as well ensures the quality of your voice renders perfectly to the listener on the other side.- Looks modern and sleek.- ANC is really good with choice of setting the level unlike QC35ii where there is zero, mid, high with NC700 you can choose individual range for what is low what is mid and high.- Ear pads are really of great quality and fit perfectly- Sound quality is balanced renders natural sounds without adding too much of effect but if you like thump then may not be the best one out there.- Touch controls are really good esp to pause by just double tapping is really neat- Putting it in the case is pretty easy unlike the foldable qc35ii. I've read reviews where people preferred foldable ones but in my personal preference keeping it in the box is pretty easy compared to qc35ii where you had to figure out which side to fold and then take care while putting it in the box that you have used the padding perfectly.Cons- The metal band makes it a little heavy compared to qc35ii and you can feel it during the initial use but will get used to it.- Butons are very flimsy and don't give the feel as qc35ii controls, they have tried to make them small and sleek but in doing so have made them really to thin and looks to be of cheap quality- Not much difference in sound quality compared to qc35ii so not a big upgrade if you are planning for.- Pairing with the app to start using it.

I have this problem with my recently purchased bose nc 700. I basically use it for MS Teams and Zoom, and I'm on the latest software version of the headphones as of today. I thought using my 700s would be a nice things for work calls, since they're not getting any use for travel! If I connect the 700s to my computer via Bluetooth, they work great for Teams and Zoom "use computer audio" options, but YOU CANNOT MUTE! This seems to be because the button on the headphones is only programmed to function as Mute when you are on a "call", such as in using your connected phone. But it cannot seem to tell when I'm using them on a Teams or Zoom meeting, so the button still functions as the Assistant shortcut, thereby doing nothing when I'm on a meeting. Thus there is no way to mute myself using the headphones, which completely defeats the purpose of using them and having a wireless headset. If I have to Mute/Unmute I have to do it on the computer within the Teams or Zoom call. I can't believe Bose doesnt have this functionality. Between missing Music Share functionality and the inability to mute myself, these 700s are not worth the month. I'm so disappointed in Bose.I have seen that UC version does support this but now i am terrible scared to purchase bose without due delingence.Moreover in Bose US or German portal a separate UC can be purchased but i still don't see that option available in indiaA bit tight ear CupIt's 10 day of use...only so will update again

Great Noise Cancelling Wireless Headphones without any doubt a True Blue Bose.But, the firmware / software definitely not upto the level of Bose. This is my first Bose and I am overwhelmed with the quality of the sound. I chose NC 700 as it can connect two devices over Bluetooth simultaneously. This is of great help (especially these days of Corona driven Webinar/WFH days) and it helps me to be present in web-meetings through PC/Lsptop and also take phone calls (android smartphone) seamlessly. Unfortunately, though it worked brilliantly with Cisco Webex, it didn't with Google Meet. However, it worked flawlessly with Microsoft Team. One issue however is that, while I am in a meeting and a phone call lands on my Android phone, NC 700 straightaway switches to my phone. This, though a great technology use, but is unwanted, as I am cut off from the meeting abruptly and others in the meeting have no idea. Whenever it happens I get an message though on my laptop that my mic is lost. But I don't know whether others who are present in the meeting get any message etc. However once the phone call ends, NC 700 switches back to my meeting on the Windows laptop.Also, the Bose Music App sometimes respond poorly. I had to reboot my NC 700 twice. Hence not 5-Star. Hope update versions of firmware and app takes care of this.

I love sound. And I have over 9 headphones and IEMs. And this one is simply the best.I am not those people who likes a heavy base - I'd rather go in for quality of sound. And sound I believe, should not be polluted by environmental noise.The Bose 700 is a marvel of tech that blots out 90% of external sound. So, noisy fans, the drilling going on in the next door magically disappears at the touch of a button.The sound: I heard the lockdown diaries by Roger Waters (basically an acoustic version of his Floyd songs). And I could hear, every crash of the cymbals with as much clarity as his thick raspy voice. I also watched The Punisher on Netflix. And boy! The sound of machine gun fire, sounds like machine gun fire. So full marks to Bose on the sound.The only trouble I am facing is, when I have to switch from watching Netflix or YouTube to a Teams or a Webex call. The audio just gives up. And I can't hear anything. Still working on it to solve the issue.Oh, and it is expensive - definitely can be cheaper. I would also check out the Sony 1000XM4 too. They are supposed to be a Bose killer.

[UPDATE AFTER 10 MONTHS]The headphones are made of very poor quality material. The earpads literally start dissolving and finer materials are falling each time. Considering that I've literally paid the most amount in an headphone, this has been pathetic. Contracted Bose and it's not even available. I can understand that due to Covid things aren't good but they literally don't pick up call, nor will they accept their manufacturing fault (search for NC 700 Silver Discoloration).Stay away from BOSE, it's better to get Airpods or buy from genuine brands such as SENNHEISER.[ORIGINAL REVIEW July 2020]I have been using these for a week now and I was hesitant at first before buying, because one, it was too costly and second, the reviews that have been mentioned doesn't give good promises. But I took the plunge anyway, but I am glad I did. Jotting down all the false reviews as mentioned:1: Yes, it does support Windows (Windows 10, 1903) without any issues whatsoever. Have been using them for Zoom, Hangouts and everything else for all my meetings and it works flawlessly with noise cancellation. Also using as a headset for games work too. You just have to select the sound output from Volume icon to Bose Headset. No crackling or static noises.2: You can use the headphones without the Bose Connect app too. You just won't get the option to change your equalizer settings (yes it is present after you update the headphones), or fine tune your noise cancellation, but it just works like any other Bluetooth headphones out-of-the box.3: Bass Not Present - I think this is personal preference, but once you update your headphones, Bose has added EQ on the Bose app. You can increase the Bass to +10 and it does sound heavy and not distorted. Overall the sound quality is good on mids and very clear on high treble. If you want Bass, then you shouldn't be looking for Bose in the first place.But I wouldn't say there aren't any hiccups with this.- The battery life is stated for 20 hours but I am only getting 16:45 hours on a full charge. This is because they advertise it without noise cancelling on.- I see many people reviewing this without 'Verified Purchase' tag on reviews, which is very weird and just praising XM3s. While XM3 were my preference too, but the only single connection at a time was a let down for me (rumors that XM4 would have multi-connection support).- High price, it should have been around 28k - 30K.I think Bose has also fixed many of the issues from earlier reviews and is now a solid choice.

At this price point everyone will know there will be no compromise at all.Bose has done a excellent job.1.Sound quality:Once upon a time i was a pure bass headüòÇ i thought that Bass is the only thing which will make you to enjoy the songs and music but when my friend gave me to use audio technica for some days i was completely blown away by the sound quality which was too realistic and detailed after that i have started to hate the extra bass bcoz more bass reduces the actual sound quality it may feel rich while listening to songs but while watching movies you can notice the loss of audio quality dramatically.Coming to this product the sound quality is well balanced highs mids lows are perfect its really a pleasure to hear music from this headphones.Comfort:This one is not definitely comfortable as bose qc 35. I didn‚Äôt got any pain in my ears but its getting bit warm while using for some hours. For those who prefer more comfort especially when you use headphones for long hours i would suggest QC 35 II stills its a best from bose.Battery:Battery is the only thing which always disappoints me when coming to the Bose. Am getting roughly around 16 to 17 hrs when ANC is ON even when the ANC is off battery life is not so impressive but the good thing is it can charge faster at least.Noice cancellation:No words to describe the ANC its the best in the market right now better than sony wh 1000mx3.Verdict: Its definitely a great product for audiophiles but the price is the biggest setback of this product atleast for under 30k it would be a great product to buy....but when the special sale arrives you can get QC 35 II under 20k so personally i will recommend you to go for QC 35 which is best value for your money or else you can wait for some months and you can get this product at a deal price during specials sale days.Overall worth for the price.

I will come straight to the point which you might be looking for i.e. Is it better than sony XM4 ?Before I answer this, let me tell you I was super confused before buying this Headphone. I was confused between Sony XM4 and Bose 700. If you are really into bass go for Sony xm4. Though you may see review and claims that sony are the leader if Noice cancellation headphone but I would say in NC sony cannot beat BOSE.2. And this headphone sound is also very good. and it's so so so so comfortable.Short answer.Prefer bose 700 over the sony xm4. PERIOD!!

After reading a lot of reviews for the amazing Sony Wh 1000XM3s and doing my own research I thought it is better to try both the pairs of headphones and i can honestly say Bose NC 700s are definitely the better ones out of the two,In terms of ANC i think sony blocks out a little more noise but it gives you a kind of plugged in feeling when you wear sony but when it comes to bose they are so comfortable, you actually forget that you are wearing any headphones,The build quality of bose is awesome, the stainless steel headband looks and feels very premium,The sound quality is awesome, but i would suggest better to try them before purchasing, as audio quality is basically something which should be experienced before making any decisions, as you are the best judge, close your eyes ,listen to music and decide which of these headphones is best.Now i mostly listen to Country music, which sounds magical on these headphones you can listen to those banjos, fiddles and guitars clearly as if each one is played live in front of you.I dont listen to a lot of pop, hip hop and EDM so wont be able to comment on that.I also listen to bluegrass music which sounds good too, but you should make your decision on the basis of the genre of music you listen to like EDM, metal, grunge, blues , jazz etc,for eg if you like a lot of base you can go for the beats by dre studio 3Bose also gives updates through the app like they have recently added the equalizer which was awaited for a long time,so all in all a very good pair of noise cancelling headphones which will be liked by a lot of people.

Full charge prompts 17 hours of battery backup but it gets drained very fast. You approximately get around 14 hours of backup.‚Äî-/////‚Äî‚ÄîThis is my final review of this product after using it for 2 years. Quality wise its good but isn't worth the price. Comfort wise its very good probably best in the market at this price.Two things i want to mention.Firstly its stopped attaining 100% charge after few months and now it never prompts battery full even if its on charging for 24 hours. You mostly get 15 hours of battery life after a period of 3 hours of charging.Secondly its ear cushion covers are falling apart recently. I guess due to perspiration its adhesive gets worn out.

Overall: Full disclosure. I have not bought this product on Amazon. Picked up one at the closest Croma electronics store since there is no price difference. The best noise cancellation headphones I have used so far. Used to use Bose qc35 II, qc20.Audio: Yes, the bass is not that great.. but the bliss of noise free environment supersedes high bass.Mic: I use it primarily for calls and the mic quality is really amazing. It picks up my voice clearly even in a really noisy place. The other party on the calls won‚Äôt even realise that I am outside most of the times.Battery: this has a friggin beast of a battery. My typical day usage contains about 4-5hrs of calls and 2-3 hrs of music/Netflix. And with this usage it lasts me just shy of 3 days on a single charge. This is more than enough for me.Connectivity: with iPhone7, there are some connectivity issues. Once in a while it just disconnects while in the middle of a call or while swapping between multiple calls. Didn‚Äôt observe any connection issues with media consumption. Also didn‚Äôt observe any issues with one plus 7T pro, MacBook and couple of other devices. So I‚Äôm guessing the connectivity issue is more of an issue with the iPhone rather than the headphones.If you ever want to invest in a good set of headphones, invest in these rather than 10 pairs of sub par ones over time. Get it on EMI or pay for it. 35k may sound a bit more for headphones but trust me they are totally worth it.

After testing multiple brands over months and finally buying this product; I can say the follows:Bose 700 is the best Wireless Headphone available today with ANC today In this price range - Period! There are better wired headphones or costlier Bluetooth headphones available BUT this is by far the best ANC Bluetooth headphone.1. Let‚Äôs start with sound quality:10/10 of you care for clear sound where each instrument and vocal shines; this beats all others in the market head down. Sony WH- 1000XM3 doesn‚Äôt even come close. You will hear sounds in a song you have never noticed before and within second you will emerge in deep vibrance of your playlist. It does justice to all genres. Base, midrange and Highs all shine. Also, don‚Äôt let the review comparing sound codecs fool you; because on IPhone or Android; the sound quality beats every other headphone.2. Noise Cancellation (9.5/10): Second to Sony WH- 1000XM3 however; if you put music on (which I am assuming is the purpose) ANC will be same as the Sony. The great thing about this headphone also is that it has no cabin pressure or ambient noise with ANC on; which is perfect.3. Call Quality (10/10): This is best Bluetooth headphones for calls amongst all headphones available. If you are looking to use the Headphones for music as well as calls; don‚Äôt give it a millisecond thought. I would rate the Sony XM3 at 5/10 compared to this.4. Battery Life and Comfort 10/10: At this price, these become basic. I was worried about comfort as I had read some review which showed concern. However, these headphones are sleek, look elegant and are super comfortable.

So i bought both the Sony WH-1000xm3 and Bose 700 and both are wonderful in their own ways, to me I liked Bose 700 a bit more just because it is a bit more comfortable for sure than the sony and the design most importantly, its stylish and wonderful, feels premium.Sony do have a wonderful bass without a doubt and it wins for sure in the overall sound quality.Both are wonderful in their own terms its on the buyer to see what he wants. I bought this for its mics. It had the best microphone quality in all the reviews and websites due to the 4 microphones. However, the bluetooth multipoint implementation is the worst and the most terrible I have ever seen, Even cheap headphones quarter the price, has better bluetooth multipoint. If you connect it with 2 devices, it randomly disconnects frequently without any warning, ABSOLUTELY FORGET about taking calls with this, while connected to your laptop. I was very skeptical by reading the negative reviews. I am using BOSE products from past seven years. My decision to buy Bose 700 is not disappointed me. This is my second Bose product, but I am sad to say that the sound quality is not up to mark. Forget about the Bass, even the mids and vocal sounds are not that great what other reviews claimed. Again like I said , since I have another Bose product (true wireless earphones) I can see the issue over there too.Noise cancellation is okay, but compared to Sony 1000x4 it is of no match.The touchpad is very responsive and I liked it, but the sensor's touch area is very small.The app sucks. It frequently disconnects the product, and the EQ often does not make me feel the difference in sound quality even if I pump up the Bass or Treble. Utterly pathetic app. Again compared to it's rival Sony product, the app lacks features too.Finally I chose the white color variant because it was relatively cheaper than the other color variant. But it is prone to attract marks and dirt. My son put some crayons on it and I can't remove it now. So don't go for this color variant at all.Overall, it is disappointing to see that Bose products are not value or money. On one hand they make a hole in your pocket and but on the other hand the value proposition is less and you would get better and cheaper options than them, e.g. Sony 1000 series, Hifiman, Audeze, Grado Prestige series etc.

My review of this product is based on the piece i bought at Reliance Digital more than 2 years ago. Excellent experience, fits well to the ears, does not cause heaviness even for long hours of calls, excellent noise cancellation and good mic.Coming to this piece that i bought from Amazon, poor sound clarity. Have not seen much bass coming, feels heavy within 20 mins of usage. The package was delivered with seal open. I returned once but again the same. Is it a problem at seller end or sony has manufactured a defective headset, i am not sure. Also is it just my feeling since the seal was broken when delivered.. Now who knows the truth. I leave it to readers best judgement before choosing to buy this item from Amazon.

These are my observations & feedback after using Sony Extra Bass MDR-XB450AP for ~ 1 week:+ MDR-XB450AP is a closed type, on-ear headphone with 3.94 ft long Y-type cord.+ sound quality is amazing, crisp and clear with boosted bass punch.+ looks are good, with classy metallic finish.+ build quality is sturdy and durable.+ headband is also sturdy and amazing. It is adjustable to suit your head.+ the cushioned ear-pads are comfortable to the ear which also helps to enclose or seal the music perfectly.+ noise cancellation works perfectly.+ it sports a tangle-free cable with looks durable, the length of the wire is perfect, neither too long nor too short, you can easily sport it outdoors.+ it is fold-able and easy to store, really portable.+ lot more comfortable than other headphones out there in this segment, not too tight and don't slide off easily.+ I didn't faced (yet) any issue of heating up of ears.+ one thing which I was interested in knowing but was not able to gather much details before purchasing, was the performance of mic. After using I can say it is really good and do the intended job perfectly. I use it for voice calls and all feedback I got from the other party about the quality of voice was always positive.+ now an important thing about the authenticity of the product as a lot of fake Sony headphones are in circulation in market. Sony has issued detailed guidelines on how to validate if your purchase is authentic. Posting a web link is not allowed here, so just search for the words "microsite mdrcaution index.html", most likely it will be the first link in google search results. Following are the three things you need to check and in my case I found all in place correctly, which confirms it is an authentic one with a July 2017 import date:>>>>> 1 year warranty sticker.>>>>> MRP sticker.>>>>> correct bar-code, ending with (E) or (IN)On the flip side:- bass can be overwhelming and little too much at times.- I did feel a little pain after 2+ hours of continuous use, but I would like to believe that is normal and a matter of getting used to it. Just want to highlight.SUMMARY => Overall, an excellent product in ~2K price segment. You can definitely go for it.Pictures posted for reference. I hope this helps.Should you need any further information, do leave a comment below, I'll definitely try to get back.

When I first got the product, it was already opened, looked used (which it was), and was defective (right one was not working at all). There was no clear plastic wrapping on the sony package. Very disappointed with amazon.I called amazon and they said they will replace for free, and if the second product is also defective then they will return my money. The second one came in 3 days and I handed over the old one to them. The second one was an unopened package, and working fine.Now PROS and CONS+ sound quality of this Sony MDR-XB450AP is at least TWICE as good as my old Sony MDR-ZX310AP.+ bass is strong and it just feels like the sound is coming from bigger drivers, which it is not.+ passive noise cancellation due to the tight fit and good quality pads is a bonus.+ build quality is very nice. feels like a premium product. It looks pretty too.+ flat cable, I dig it!+ when I increase the volume, the headphones just keeps giving more!+ the mic works but nothing special about it. But I didn't buy it for the mic.- as mentioned above, the fit is tight, and that can be a problem. Sweat + Pain after extended use.- if I am nitpicking it feels like it is missing something, in the mids and highs.UPDATE- I'd wear MDR-ZX310AP for a whole movie without taking it off but with this new MDR-XB450AP I'd giving my paining and sweating ears a break every 20 mins.VERDICTNot worth it since it is not comfortable. Ear pains after 20 mins of use. So the amazing audio quality is irrelevant. Do not buy.

I have been using sub standard headphones previously, which needed me to keep my volume levels at 60% and more sometimes depending on the website. Now with this, I keep my volume levels on my pc very low (36%) which is good for your ears. On a personal note, I had a major issue with Amazon prime videos having a very low sound quality. My previous headphones even at 100% volume levels would sometimes not catch some dialogues or important sounds making it a very unsatisfactory experience. Similar problems with some other websites too like watching Snyder cut on bookmyshow. These headphones give a brilliant experience at 36-45% pc volume levels and obviously for music lovers , this gives a very good experience, bass et al. Wearing it for too long (4-5 hours zoom call) did give a slight discomfort in the ear. I switched to my old headphones for the zoom calls and anything else that requires me to wear headphones for a 4-5+ hr period etc and keep these headphones for movies,music and other stuff. I feel overtime these headphones will also become discomfort free once they loosen up.

Product is plastic but unlike other products, it doesn't seem to have received complaints of wear and tear of breaks frlm whoever recommended me these.4. It reduces the background noise to half the moment you wear it. That's a very good thing.Disappointing thing:In the name of extra Bass, not only it muffles the overall sound, especially treble, but when you use the treble boost equalizer setting to play a song, the clarity of lyrics is not good. I have received better quality sound in boAt Bassheads 900 wired heaphone that costs only 700 rupees. I have used this device on iPhone, Oppo, OnePlus and Sony phones, and found the quality to be disappointing. Worst part, YouTube doesn't have an equalizer setting, so you have to adjust with the extra bass muffled sound.Giving it three stars because a product far less in price such as boAt is giving unmatched clarity. People who need only bass in their songs and are okay with the clarity of the singer's voice muffled, will find it a good choice..

Really an outstanding headphone from Sony..i was searching a headphone which will give nice and clean sound, a very good amount of bass, clarity etc..which i most often want this type of performance on headphone..my search is complete and i opted for Sony..Sony is really a mindblowing headphone it has really a good crystal clear sound, will give you good amount of bass, treble is also fine..it really won't dissapoint anyone with its performance..i'm quite very much happy that i have spend my money very well for this product..i just bought this product at just Rs 2000 which i won't say quite high or low still a promising price according to its performance and it's build quality..i'm really happy with it's performance..product was nicely packed haven't faced any difficulty while opening the box..build quality is awesome..it has really a smooth and nice finish..black in colour..wire is quite long and the quality is outstanding..it looks very nice while going outside with your headphone..we can also use this headphone for gaming purpose also very good gaming headphone as well..a all rounder headphone i would say..sound is very crystal clear and the clarity what to say outstanding..bass is outstanding..giving a tough fight to my JBL T450 headphone..mic sound quality is awesome voice is very crystal clear .have been using this headphone for 2 week no issues faced still now..overall a great deal to buy..i would recommend everyone to buy this headphone who is searching like this type of quality..a must buy headphone from Sony..thank you amazon..

Excellent audio quality, something that you would expect from Sony. Fits the head well. I use this mostly with my Oneplus 3 phone, and occasionally with HP laptop.Cons:1. Backside of the package mentioned that not all phones are compatible with the mic. I tried to use it for phone calls but the other party could not hear me. Searched everywhere for solution and finally found that there is an Android app from Sony called Smart Connect. After installing and configuring it, my mic works. Wish Sony had given some clarification about this in the user manual provided.2. Mic picks up all background noise, not too useful for official conference calls unless you are in silent place.3. Head band is adjustable, but unless you set it tight - it could slip off at times. When you set it tight, you will feel uncomfortable after 10 minutes. May depend on head size...

I have been using this since 2 years now. Overall the quality of the headphones is fine. The bass is super punchy. Sound quality is good. However do not expect it to stay in shape for long. After 2 years of sparing use the headband has become loose. Also the gum holding the ear pads has come off and now the inner foam is exposed. This has not really affected its functionality but it looks shabby. I am wondering if the ear cups (cushions) can be replaced. In case someone has any idea do let me know..Update:3 years now and one of the earcups have come off. I took it to the service center just to check if they can replace both the earcups and to my surprise the response I got was really bad. Any damage to the earcup is considered as an accidental damage and even if it is under warranty, it won't be entertained. Mine was anyway out of warranty so I was ready to pay for the replacement but I was told that this is not possible. In fact any issue with the headphones/earphones after the warranty is not Serviceable and this holds true for any range of earphones or headphones you buy from Sony in India. (The lady told me that even if it was a 25k earphone the response would be same!!) I was in fact planning to buy a premium wireless headphone from Sony which after this experience I have dropped.
Good

Exit JBL, Exit Bose, Exit Sony - Enter AudioTechnica M30XBefore I start this review, I want to mention that I see a lot of reviews on many websites including Amazon which review a Car and then talk about I) the taste of tyres 2) the smell of the bumper 3) The colour of the chassis. DOES IT MAKE SENSE? Well, if it doesnt please understand that we better talk of build quality, packaging and sound when it comes to a headphone and not about our favourite colour, odour of the box or the thickness of the instruction manual paper.Lets get the basics right. We classify music into:Highs = treble, cymbals (typically 4000-20000Hz)Mids = midrange, female opera singer (350-4000Hz);Lows = bass (20-350 Hz)We also need to assure that the sound quality from the source is the best. This means your old Bollywood songs do not require good headphones and if at all, its a waste of money. Based on these parameters I would rate AudioTechnica for the following songs1) Cypress Hill - Insane in the BrainHighs - NAMids -10/10Lows - 9/10The M30X captures all the details that one might have missed on other headphones. The mids are splendidly captured, again with good details of the lead vocals. The lows are exceedingly satisfactory but neutral. Bassheads need to look elsewhere.2) Edward Maya - Historia de AmorHighs - 10/10Mids -10/10Lows - NAOnce again the M30X captures sounds that one could not hear due to a bad headphone. The highs and mids are a treat to the year. Pure pleasure.3) Radiohead - CreepHighs - 10/10Mids -10/10Lows - 10/10I love this song. Its one of the best songs to test your headphone along with some tracks from Prodigy and many more. The synchronized chord progression is repeated throughout the whole song, alternating between arpeggiated chords in the verses and last chorus, complimented by loud power chords during the first two choruses.The M30X are unbelievably good here. You really fall in love with these headphones.Trust me, these headphones are a league. If at all I would have to recommend a change it would be a better earpad quality and a Bluetooth for the same price. I know I am demanding for a lot more at this price. Having said that, the M30X are the best balanced headphones in this series. The M50X and M40X are typically for studio use and do not fit in much for personal usage unless your ears are paranormal or you are an alien who can listen to abnormal frequencies. The build quality is very good but could have been much, much better to be the best. The accessories (extension chord and leather bag) are really impressive. Just assure that you listen to the best quality of music from the best possible source and see the magic. Highly Recommended + 10/10.

The sound quality is really good and is comfortable to wear for short durations. They can get uncomfortable after a while.These headphones are not noise cancelling but, more appropriately, should be called noise isolating. They are able to remove most of the background noise (about 70-80%) when playing music.

I've had these headphones for nearly 5 years now, still haven't seen more than a crack in the leather. Supreme sound quality, excellent noise cancellation and fitting too.However if you are bothered by the aching of your temple and ears after long usage periods and an extremely long wire, I'd recommend going for the ATH-M50x.They're excellent monitor headphones, responds to equaliser changes perfectly and you can hear every detail sitting anywhere. Yet, they're not the best choice to take outdoors and can't be worn around your neck.Overall a positive choice if you're willing to shell out 5.5k

Tested these new cans with a whole of different music ranging from EDM, Rock, Classical, Shanker Tucker, Prem Joshua on different devices like Samsung E5, iPhone5, laptop and PC.I play the synth occasionally and these still need to be tried out on those. I have previously owned JVC HA ‚Äì S600, AKG K55, Beyerdynamic DT770 Pro and Skull Candy.So here goes‚Ä¶.Pros :Professional build quality.Perfectly balanced.Amazing Soundstage! You can clearly distinguish the different instruments and sound is so CRISP! Was able to hear elements on music which were previously getting lost in low-quality earphones.Decent bass ‚Äì punchy and complements the overall sound, doesn‚Äôt overpower it. Bass heads, you might want to look elsewhere or buy a headphone amp which is another 2k. JVC bass felt so coloured in hindsight.Detailed clarity with outstanding mid-range re-production. Vocal clarity is astounding! It is the best headphones vocalists can use in this price rangeHighs are pretty goodComfortable cans, with well cushioned ear pads.Cons :Impedence of 47 ohms might be a lil less to power these. Please note these are studio headphones and therefore low powered devices may lack the required output.Long wire (Duh! Like you didn‚Äôt know it before you bought!)May need to tweak the equalizer for the most optimal sound depending on genre.A wee-bit more focus on mids but not a deal-breaker.Bottomline : One of the best cans in this price rangeWill update the review after the burn in is complete‚Ä¶

Well, I will make this short. Do you have a budget of five thousand rupees? And do you want to delve into the world of good audio?If your answer is yes to both the questions, buy these headphones without any doubt.They sound marvellous. Now I cannot use another pair of Sony or Skullcandy because these pair make me want more. You get no coloration of your audio. You hear it as it was intended to be heard. No extra bass, but you will get the most minute of details. Comfort is okay. Don't go out running wearing these. Sit, relax and blow away your mind! Durability, let's say rock solid is a good way to describe it. I have literally thrown them around the house.Now for the criticism; nothing is perfect after all. After 20 months of use, over 2500 hours clocked in, the right channel stopped working a month ago. No one is replying to my calls, messages or e-mails. After sales service is non-existent. I am really sad because these headphones were not that cheap, people don't earn what they cost in a month, in our country. But Audio Technica does not feel the need to address this issue.Now, I do not know if your pair will outlast you or get delivered to you broken, but these are the best for the buck.

This is a really good headphone.Let me start off with the delivery, it arrived on time, was in a bigger package than what I had in mind. The package was a little damaged, though not a lot. The unpacking experience was quite good. Everything was neatly packed and covered. The carry pouch looks like it'll hold for quite a long time. The headphones look fabulous... They could be folded up easily. The 3.5 mm jack was hidden under the bigger one. The cable is really long, too long for travel purposes, so I recommend you tie it up. The earcups cover your ears perfectly and smoothly. Felt very good. I usually get hot ears very fast, but using these, it took longer for my ears to heat up, and it wasn't too hot... The noise isolation is really good. You couldn't hear your own voice at high volumes. Don't use high volumes for long intervals though. With that said, the quality of sound was just pure. The lows, the mids, the highs, everything was so crisp. I heard instruments that I've never heard in songs that I've played thousands of times before. A true professional look and feel to it. It is made out of plastic, but quality is top notch. Certainly something I'd suggest you to buy if you have the money. I of course got it at the discounted rate. It's like the best headphone at this price range. The surround sound effects are heavenly! I don't enjoy too much bass, so this was perfect for me as everything was equally balanced. Highly recommended.

I had bought M20X earlier and had been using it for more than a year until my dog chewed up the wire. Which gave me the perfect opportunity to upgrade to M30X. The foldability of these headphones is very convenient.It comes with a carry pouch. Which the lower models don‚Äôt include.The sound and noise cancellation is perfect for audiophiles.However prolonged used makes my ears sweat and without cleaning and proper maintenance the padding over time can start cracking. But then again I was living in a really hot area at the time this happened with my previous headphones.

Been using them for 1 year 4 months these are best in such range my music production and mixing skills have been increase since I started producing with them, give them a little time to adjust with your hearing senses and you will find how better they are, can't wear them more than 4-5 hours continuously, though you should give you ears some ears after every one hour of using any headphones set but these are the best for music production purposes and listening to music as well!

I felt that the reviews are overhyped.Considering 3 factors and from a consumer poinr of view not a professional,my overall rating is 2.1.Sound quality2. Comfort3.Build Quality & Value for money1. Yes,sound is above average but nothing like mindblowing.For people saying that bass on other headsets is not desirable ,adjusting the equalizer settings can reduce bass and enhance vocals or treble.I have quad DAC support on my phone so most headsets give clear sound that is quite similar to the source.Noise cancellation is quite ordinary.Sound rating : 3.5/52. Comfort:These are not so comfortable in my opinion. The long wire also hinders portability.I can't think of carrying these outside so I use the other earphone whole travelling or walking.Also it feels heavy on the ear after a while.Rating :1.5/53.Build Quality and Value for money.Build quality and design is average.I have used headsets at half the price having better and having an eye catching design.Also the wire can get tangled easily.At 6k,this headphone does not offer value for money.I suppose it is mainly designed for professionals involved in studio recordings.But as a consumer,I would go for a 2-3 k range headset which is more comfortable and has a better design and is more portable over this.Rating: 1.5/5

After using M20X, this was a natural choice. The sound was better than the M20X and the ability to fold was an added bonus. Overall it was a upgrade from M20X.BUT the headphones didn't last long. Left side stopped working in just 13 months which was disappointing. Even more disappointing was the fact that the M20X lasted far longer than these ones. I'm not sure if I can trust Audio-Technica going forward after this experience.

I brought these headphones (realme buds 2) after reading so many reviews and some people also mentioned these headphones in reviews of other headphones/earbuds. Hope my review will help some.One thing for sure about these buds, these are not for bass lovers. People love these headphones because they are perfectly tuned and there are no harsh frequencies that give uncomfortable feeling while listening to music or answering a call. I tried applying EQ to decrease high pitch sounds and boost the bass but still these are only decent at bass.Personally I felt little bit pain in ears after applying these buds over 20 30 minutes.Build quality, mic and sound clarity are good in these headphones, at least for now.Overall these headphones are overrated as it depends upon personal preferences. If you need bass then better go for boAt bassheads or a decent all rounder mi dual driver otherwise for casual use and gaming these buds are fine.

I have been using wired earphones from a very long time. I must say that it's damn good. Great quality product. The wires won't be damaged anytime soon if you handle with care. Light weight and kind of fixes perfectly in ear. Good product in this price range. Noise cancellation is just litüî•

1.Build Quality even @‚Çπ524 is shockingly good and Realme Buds 2 feels so premium (5/5).2.Sound Quality is very good. I already have Sennheiser cx213. So, I can feel that Buds 2 can not produce cx213's 'Pure' sound, but is not much behind(Price of cx213 is ‚Çπ1100 now)A. Bass is puchy, tight, esp. lower bass(5/5). Cx213's bass is less tight & punchy, but not much lessB. Mids are so clear(4/5). Cx213's mids are better.C. Highs are supressed a little (3/5), Cx213's highs are far better, but it's highs often hurt ears3.Buds 2 has lots of features like magnetic earbuds,play-pause,volume control,cords are tangle free ,etc..all these add to premium user experience(5/5)4.Voice Clarity during call is very good and sound is rich; noise cancellation is good, not ANC type5.Earbud are very comfortable for music playing for even 3-5 hrs continuously, no painonly drawback is it's jack is not L shaped.I like both, like two little babies;I also have Tagg Sonic Angle 1 Bluetooth speaker.Man,Tagg is like a 'Chhota Bomb', my favoriteand going to buy Obage HT 244 4.1 music system..

Pros: This is actually the audio quality I needed. Perfectly blend bass and treble. Tried using equalizer to enhance the treble and demn! Build quality is gud too with braided cables. Magnetic earcups too is gud. Perfect fit for ears.Cons: They say its tangle-free but the wire of left and right earcups gets tangles maybe its cus its new. The end of the earphone is a straight up connector and prolly there's a chance u gotta disconnect the earphone by pulling its wires which might cause wires to stretch and break.Conclusion: Best value for money earphone I have ever bought

I bought these earphones mostly for sake of having flexibility of wired ones. I have realme airbuds 3 neo too and they sound fantastic as compared to these but these are fine. I mean it says 11.2 mm bass boost driver and all but it rolls off quickly below 40hz. It just mid-bass boosted. Welp, having such a huge driver does affect high frequency and it is quite evident when listening to songs. I have attached an image of poweramp equalizer setting to make it sound most balanced( of course you can tune it the way you like). I've had earphones costing double ,tripple the amount (sony mh something and Sennheiser cx 213) and they were really off with harsh peaks but had better details. This one is just a bit more b√†lanced with no harsh peaks but with less detailing. Mic is also fine. So far a good daily beater.

I'm absolutely in love with these headphones. I decided to switch to over ear headphones since earbuds just don't fit properly in my ears and feel like they'll fall off any second. I've been using these non-stop for the past 2 months now and they're still working as new. I'm a very reckless user so the fact that there's not even a single scratch on them is amazing. The sound quality is great compared to the shitty stuff I've been using before.One drawback is that it gets loose very fast. It does get a bit annoying since I always keep my hair open and it sometimes slides here and there, almost slipping off my head if I look down for too long. A quick fix is to tie a rubber band around it overnight so it fits nice and snug in the morning. I also wish there was more emphasis on the bass but you can just tweak the equaliser on the app and it's all good.One more thing is that I wish these were noise cancelling. I use public transport, so I have to use a volume booster because of how loud the background noise gets.Lookswise, It looks very sleek and modern which goes with all outfits.If you're on a budget and you want a good quality pair of headphones that look good as well, these are the best ones!!

To the point.Pros:1) Good build quality at the price range (Rs1299)2) Metal frame.3) Ear cups are sturdy and should last decently.4) Bluetooth pairing is fast with no call or audio drops noticed.5) Good amount of Bass.Cons:1) the ear cups are a bit tight and my ears hurt a little after 2 hrs of continuous listening.2) Too much Bass, cuts off the mid and high frequency A LOT. this impacts the following sound profile:a) separation of other audio frequencies becomes less audible/noticeable.b) hampers stereo separation which is evident.c) noticeable distortion and lower to mid-gain levels.d) THIS IS FOR ZEB TEAM TO IMPROVE ON THEIR NEXT HEADPHONES=THE AUDIO FROM THE HEADPHONE SOUNDS LIKE IT HAS BEEN PASSED FROM A CABINET AMP SIMULATION/PLUGIN, lacks MID LEVEL VIBRANCE + CHANNEL SEPARATION + NEEDS LOW FREQ CUTOFF.Verdict" considering the price, this is what you get, if you want to listen to music with good bass and on a budget then go for it. For the rest go for something else.Audio correction: Every listener has her/his own liking for their sound signature. Use an equalizer plugin/app/software for your pc/mobile if you want to change the default sound of this headphone to suit you.

I'm absolutely thrilled with my Bluetooth 5.2 Wireless In-Ear Headphones! The 18-hour playtime keeps me entertained all day, and the deep bass truly elevates my music experience. HD calls are crystal clear, and dual device pairing is a game-changer. Voice assist is a handy feature, and the Type-C fast charge is a lifesaver. Plus, the IPX4 water resistance gives me peace of mind during workouts. These headphones offer incredible value.

These Wireless In-Ear Headphones have been a game-changer for my daily routine. The 18-hour playtime is a true lifesaver during long workdays and commutes, and the deep bass quality makes my music come alive like never before.What's really impressive is the HD call quality ‚Äì I've had more crystal-clear conversations than ever, even in noisy environments. The dual device pairing feature is incredibly convenient, switching seamlessly between my phone and laptop. Voice assist and Type-C fast charging are like icing on the cake.Being IPX4 water-resistant, they've survived my intense workouts without a hiccup. These headphones have become my indispensable companions, and I can't imagine life without them. Highly recommended for anyone seeking quality and convenience in one package!

I recently got these headphones and have been thoroughly impressed with their performance. The sound quality is exceptional, with clear and crisp highs and deep and rumbling lows. The battery life is also impressive, lasting for an entire day of use and then some. I love that I can easily control my music and calls with the built-in voice assistant, and the dual device pairing feature is a game-changer for someone like me who likes to switch between two devices frequently.The neckband design is comfortable and lightweight, making these headphones perfect for all-day wear. I also appreciate the IPX4 water resistance, which gives me peace of mind when I'm exercising or working in wet conditions. Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with these headphones and would definitely recommend them to anyone looking for high-quality wireless in-ear headphones.

I've been using these headphones for a few days now, and while I have some mixed feelings about them. On the positive side, the sound quality is great - the bass is deep and rumbly, and the mids and highs are clear and detailed. I also appreciate the convenience of wireless connectivity, and the fact that the headphones can charge quickly in the charging case.However, there are a few things that are a bit disappointing. Firstly, the fit isn't the most comfortable - the earbuds tend to shift around in my ears, which can be a bit annoying. Secondly, the battery life could be better - I find myself having to recharge the headphones more often than I'd like. And finally, the price is a bit steep - I feel like I could get similar quality headphones for less money from other brands.Overall, I'd say these headphones are good but not great. They deliver on sound quality and convenience, but fall short in terms of comfort and value for money. If you're looking for a high-quality wireless headphone that's comfortable and offers great sound, there are definitely other options out there that might be a better fit for you.

I recently got my hands on the Ptron Bassbuds, and I must say, they have been quite a pleasant surprise. As a budget-conscious consumer, I was initially skeptical about their performance, but after putting them to the test, I'm impressed with what they offer for the price.Sound Quality: The standout feature of the Ptron Bassbuds is their audio quality. The bass response is punchy and powerful, as the name suggests. For bass enthusiasts, these earbuds won't disappoint. However, the bass isn't overpowering and still maintains a good balance with the mids and highs. The overall sound signature leans towards warmth, which makes them ideal for genres like pop, hip-hop, and electronic music.Design and Comfort: The design of the Ptron Bassbuds is sleek and compact, with a glossy finish that gives them a premium appearance. The earbuds fit snugly in my ears and come with multiple ear tip sizes, ensuring a comfortable fit for extended use. I appreciate the inclusion of touch controls, which are intuitive and responsive for managing playback, volume, and calls without reaching for my device.Battery Life: The battery life on the Ptron Bassbuds is quite impressive. On a full charge, I was able to get around 4.5 to 5 hours of continuous playback, and the charging case provided an additional 20 hours, which is more than enough for my daily needs. The USB Type-C charging port is a welcomed addition for quicker and hassle-free charging.Connectivity: Pairing the Bassbuds with my smartphone was effortless, and they maintained a stable connection with minimal dropouts during use.Call Quality: While the sound quality for music playback is excellent, the call quality on the Ptron Bassbuds is average. Callers on the other end reported my voice to be slightly muffled, and the built-in microphone didn't provide the best noise isolation in noisy environments.Final Thoughts: The Ptron Bassbuds offer exceptional value for money, providing an impressive audio experience at a budget-friendly price point. They excel in bass reproduction, making them a great choice for bass lovers. The design, comfort, and battery life are commendable, and the inclusion of touch controls is a definite plus. While the call quality could be improved, it's not a deal-breaker considering the overall package.If you're on a budget and seeking a pair of wireless earbuds that deliver on sound performance and functionality, the Ptron Bassbuds are an excellent choice

Right now I'm using this earbuds for around 20 days and the sound is very satisfactory. The bass and treble is quite clear and I think the sound quality is really good for the price. But there's only one single flaw in this device which is the latency. While gaming I almost hear sounds after like 55ms which is apparently equivalent to 1 second almost. The packaging says they provide a latency of 40 ms but it's not even close to 40. Hence the earbuds is a big no no for multiplayer games where sound is a key factor. Overall the conclusion is phantom 700 is good for music and casual gaming.

I am using wings phatom 340 since from 2months and the experience behind this earbuds is fantastic.Sound Quality: A good pair of earbuds should deliver clear, balanced audio with good bass response, clear mids, and detailed highs. Look for earbuds with high-quality drivers and possibly support for advanced audio codecs like AAC and aptX for improved wireless audio quality.Comfort and Fit: Comfortable earbuds are essential, especially if you plan to use them for extended periods. Look for models that come with different ear tip sizes or ear wings to ensure a secure and snug fit for your ears.Battery Life: Long battery life is crucial for uninterrupted listening. Look for earbuds that offer several hours of playback on a single charge, and a case that provides extra charges on the go.Connectivity: For wireless earbuds, consider the Bluetooth version and its range. Bluetooth 5.2 is preferable for better connectivity and stability.
