This will be a little long review, you can scroll down for my conclusion on this product.Note - Ive talked about Rockerz Trinity below this.Giving context -I've been an avid user of "Boat Rockerz 255 Pro +" (the one i was using before this, was purchased on 12 August 2021).On an average it used to last me 3ish days before i needed to charge it, my use was, Full volume or 80% volume, an average of 10 hours a day use.My experience with boat products in general has been extremely positive including their post sales service if you product suffers some manufacturing defect and is within the warranty period.Upon looking into reviews for trinity and it's claimed battery life i kind of went in with closed eyes. (Yes there is a risk of the product malfunctioning sometimes, but then the best of them have this risk.)So my experience in comparison to me previous earphone is as follows.#Sound quality -- The Signature sound mode is the same that you get on rockerz 255 pro +, BUT more Bass (always a welcoming change).-(5/5)- Vocals and other sounds in general a clear and crisp (If your music distorts at high volumes, you might wanna consider getting a better file, Flac is always better than Mp3, just saying.) (5/5)- As for the balanced mode, it was "Meh" at best for me, maybe others mind find it useful, it's more of a personal preference, but less bass is a no no for me. (3.5/5)#Battery life-- The claim is of 150 hours, but i got an effective life of 70ish hours. (4/5)- For context, i started using trinity out of the box when i got it on 23rd of July, and charged it in the evening of 29th. As a student a good 10 hours a day use, at minimum, with volume at 70% and occasionally 100% (Do note, 150hours is rated for 60% volume.)- I got to the 70 hours mark along with using Dual pairing (my tablet and phone)- ASAP charge give the charging times as you'd expect, approx 45 mins for 20% to 100% (100% as in when the charging light turns off)-Type C charging is seen.#Comfort and Fit--In comparison to my old earphones, these are a better fit, probably because of a higher quality plastic and smooth edges.(4.5/5)-As for the buds, you can choose what fits you since 3 types are available overall.-Also the magnetic earbuds seem to be stronger and yet not too strong to be a hassle. (4.5/5)#Call Quality and connectivity- As per my family and friends my voice was more clear and crisp in comparison to my old earphones, so this is a Win for me.(5/5)#Gaming Mode (Beast Mode)- Honestly in my opinion all bluetooth earphones are inferior to wired earphones, but as far as Bluetooth earphones go, the latency of 65ms is justified, for the price point this is good. (3.5/5)#Volume and power rockers-- The buttons on this are good, id say even better than my previous earphones and the material is premium feeling. (5/5)#Conclusion -When i had purchased my Boat Rockerz 255 pro + they are at the same price point of Trinity. So it's like buying the same earphones with a massive upgrade to sound and battery.In my opinion, for a price of 1499, they are an easy buy. And with boat's reputation, the post sales service is as good as it gets.

I have purchased this headphones just after its release, that means before writing this review i get to use this headphones for almost a month now.So after a month of experience here it is...1. Battery:As expected amazing battery, they showcase 150hrs, but after using it daily for atleast 7 to 8 hrs and on sat and sun 10 to 12 hrs my battery backup has been amazing. This headphones go for almost 2 weeks without charge. So I'd say this headphones can give you atleast 90 to 100hr of backup.2 sound quality:I am a sound enthusiast so for me having atleast a nice sound for cheap headphones is a must, and i must say that this headphones have not disappointed me, their signature sound mode is what i use daily, as the balanced mode is just awefull.Also the noise cancellation is ZERO so dont expect anything.3. Built quality:Material is plastic, the earbuds, the button board everything here is plastic, not expecting this last more than a year if used daily.4. Length:This is a lengthy neckband, image having 1.5m cable and making a necband out of it. This is what this headphones are, and because of that the are not going sit tight on your neck they will be loose and often times, will be irritating as they will be just falling.Conclusion:Overall good headphones with decent quality, as i like to have good battery so this one are definitely for me and with this price range i do recommend this one. Only the issue is the length of the neckband, and the plastic quality of it could be improved.

There is nothing wrong with the looks of the Bullets Z2, they are actually quite decent looking. They are just a neckband, and this is what neckbands look like, and we have made our peace with it. The middle part is a thicker, slightly more stiff, U shaped-silicon band, with two chunky pill-shaped units at the end. The wires stem from these pills and have earbuds on the end. One of these pill-shaped units houses the battery, while the other has control options and the USB Type C port on the side. You get volume buttons on this control unit and a multi-function play/pause button. The battery unit has the OnePlus branding and the logo, while the volume buttons are highlighted in red.The earbuds on the end are pretty standard, with eartips on one side and a flat back with magnets. When the buds are attached together, they will simply stop playing the audio, which you can resume once you put them back in. The Bullets Wireless Z2 are quite light and can be worn around the neck all day without ever feeling like a burden. The material used is quite skin-friendly and feels quite sturdy as well. It also comes with an IP55 rating.Pairing the OnePlus Bullets Wireless Z2 is a pretty fuss-free process. All you have to do is press and hold the play/pause button, and the buds will go into pairing mode. You can then look up the buds in the list of Bluetooth pairings on your device and connect the buds. Once connected, the Bullets Z2 will connect to your phone automatically once you put them on.You get the usual volume buttons on the buds and another button in the middle in terms of controls. Now instead of simply sharing the command load amongst its button comrades, OnePlus has put all the burden on this one button in the middle. Apart from the usual pairing/play/ pause/ call receiving/ call ending functions (which are already a lot for a single button), OnePlus has also made it responsible for changing tracks. You have to press the button twice to skip to the next song and thrice to go back to the last song. It may all sound simple but can actually be chaotic in practice as you have to keep track of how many times you have pressed that tiny button before the command is completed.The OnePlus Bullets Wireless Z2 comes with the biggest drivers seen on a pair of OnePlus earphones- 12.4mm. The fact that OnePlus is offering such big drivers for under two thousand rupees is a major plus point for the buds. The earbuds support two audio codecs, SBC and AAC.As for the audio performance, the Bullets Wireless Z2 are pretty loud and come with plenty of bass, something that seems to be every brand‚Äôs audio formula in the budget segment. While this kind of signature sound gives the audio some faux body, it actually fails to deliver what the audio is truly supposed to sound like.If you are someone looking for a pair of earphones that offer balanced sound, then you might not like the sound profile that the Bullets Wireless Z2 offer as they lack balance, majorly.That said, if you are someone who likes bass-heavy audio output and do not mind if some bass sneaks into your mids, then the OnePlus Bullets Wireless Z2 will definitely be your cup of tea.The OnePlus Bullets Wireless Z2 were pretty good in terms of call quality. We could hear the speaker clearly, and we heard no complaints whatsoever regarding our audio quality while using the buds. As the buds fit deep into your ear canals, they offer really good passive noise cancellation.They come with big 12.4 mm drivers, offer really long battery life, have a bass-heavy signature sound, and have a really solid build. But because the earbuds are really bass-heavy, they lack balance, and for those who like to listen to melodious or classical music, these might not be a great option.The Bullets Wireless Z2 also face some heat from the likes of Oppo Enco M32 and the Realme Buds 2, which are priced in the same vicinity. The OnePlus Bullets Wireless Z2 are actually a great proposition for the price; you only need to have a liking for bass.

Pros:‚Ä¢ Sound signature & quality is very good.‚Ä¢ Bass, Treble, Lows-Highs-Mids are also very good, you can hear every instrument in the music properly.‚Ä¢ Build quality is also very good.‚Ä¢ Battery life is amazing. And battery charging is also very fast.‚Ä¢ Latency & range is also very good.Cons:‚Ä¢ No Dual Pairing.‚Ä¢ ANC is missing.‚Ä¢ Call Pick - Call Drop Button (Main Button) which also used as Play-Pause Button placement is inconvenient. You'll have inconvenience finding the button everytime you're doing something.‚Ä¢ Because they are very lightweight, when you ride bike over 60-70 kmph they starts floating (it's subjective).‚Ä¢ Cords which are attached to the neck frame, those cords are slightly short. If you have a long neck (like me) you'll feel this problem.Conclusion:Must recommend for music lovers. They should have included ANC, Dual Pairing and made them slightly more heavier. Otherwise they are great to go.

So, here's my review.Pros:-1. The design and build quality is sturdy and nice.2. Sound quality is good, you won't have any bad sound quality even in maximum volume.3. Battery backup is good too(in my usage the battery lasts for 20hrs atleast, i listen to music, stay on call sometimes at lower volume until 70% volume.).4. The fast charging is a game changer here, I'm a quite busy person and i have no time to wait for my phone to even get charge sometimes, and here this neckband dominates, it charges within 15-20mins from 0-100%.5. Bass is also good.Cons:-1. The main con i found here is the latency. If you play games like PUBG or COD type games competitively then it might not be the ideal option gor you because the ping is really detectable (difference between when you shoot the bullet and when you hear sound) it's around 90-100ms. So i will not recommend it for gaming.Overall, I'm satisfied with what i bought, this product is worth of buying if you're a office worker or something then go for it. You can enjoy the high quality sound and stable connection.If you're a gamer then i would recommend for something else. I'm not really into games that much and also, i have a different headphone which is good for gaming stuff.Sorry for writing a long review and thank you for reading.

Sound quality - Perfect who love balanced sound. Base lovers will also like it as it has that BOOM base. Perfect to listen to all kind of music. If base is needed, tune the equalizer in JBL app. I like to listen to music in nuetral sound and watch movies, so no tuning needed for those.Stand out feature is Battery life. Got these on Wednesday.. listened to music, watching youtube videos and movies for 2-3 hours daily and after 4 days, battery life is at 80-90 %. Once charged, I think these headphones will last for weeks. (atleast a week on heavy usage and ANC on)Noise cancellation is not good. With ANC on, you still are able to hear outside noise when music is not playing. With normal music or movies playing, ANC works fine, you are dont hear anything from outside. Talk Through feature works great.CON: Wearing comfort is not good or as expected. After 30 mins or so, ears start to heat and sweat. If you live in warm climate, it will feel uncomfortable to wear after some time. If you have AC on in the room, then it does not matter or just remove the headphones for a min after sometime, and it should be fine. The earpads should have had some air circulation.I like JBL sound tuning and have multiple earphones and sound bar all from JBL. If you like JBL for its sound quality, then these wont disappoint.

I like this product for the value for money it provides. I've been using this headphone for the past week and I'm happy to report that my experience has been pleasant while using these for a person who's not a hardcore audiophile.PROs:(a) Comfortable over the ear fit for average ear size; headphones do not feel heavy over long use(b) Over par, more than advertised battery life. Easily lasts a week with heavy usage and ANC turned off. And 3-4 days with moderate ANC usage.(c) App support is amazing on android. Provides the following features:(i) Active Noise Cancellation(ii) Ambient Noise Aware(iii) Talkthrough(iv) Self voice aware volume control(v) Equalizer support (bass, extra bass modes pre-configured - +ve experience using them)(vi) Separate Audio and Video modes for consuming content(d) Almost negligible noise bleed(e) Solid build quality. Tactile buttons. Travel friendly (foldable ear cups)Some minor CONs:(a) ANC could be better. Not very strong ANC(b) Button placement could be better(c) Foam in the ear muffs is built to last and not comfy if cups lay over your ear cartilages for long duration (if you have bigger ears).(d) dark blue colour just looks horrendously cheap in daylight as outside shell material is plastic. Go for black, white or purple (if it ever comes back in stock)

Cons:Poor Microphone: The microphone's performance is subpar, which can be a letdown for making calls or using voice commands.Low Sound Quality: The sound quality is lacking, particularly in terms of depth and bass, resulting in an underwhelming audio experience.Bulky Design: The headphones are notably bulky, which may affect their portability and comfort.Discomfort: They tend to cause discomfort and pain after a short period of wear, which is a significant drawback for long listening sessions.Pros:Good Battery Life: These headphones offer a decent battery life, which is great for extended use without frequent recharging.Fast Pairing: The quick and hassle-free pairing process is convenient for connecting to your devices.Dual Pairing: The ability to connect to two devices simultaneously is a handy feature for multitasking.Overall, these headphones have their strengths in terms of battery life, fast pairing, and dual connectivity. However, the microphone quality, sound quality, bulkiness, and discomfort during prolonged use are notable drawbacks. Depending on your priorities, you may want to consider alternative headphones that better suit your needs and preferences.

Writing this review after 2 days of usage:Audio/Music: If you are like me and love clear vocals and crisp music then these headphones are for you. Not for bass lovers.Call clarity is very good. The other side didn‚Äôt hear any background noise and I could hear their voice very clearly. Call clarity when connected to the aux is fine as well. No issues in attending phone calls wireless and wired.Note 1: For multiplayer gaming I connect the headphones using the aux cable but the other players are not able to hear me clearly. Wirelessly you won‚Äôt be able to hear the sounds (I tested CS:GO). In single player games, the headphone supports both wireless and wired connections.Note 2: Microsoft Teams and Skype do not support these headphones. So unfortunately you have to wear your earphones to attend office calls if Microsoft teams and Skype is being used.Note 3: No audio delay on YouTube. (Tested both wireless and wired connections)Comfort: Even with my glasses on I experienced no discomfort whatsoever and the cushions are so soft I had no issues wearing these for 3-4 hours on a stretch (if your glasses have thick frames then maybe you have to adjust quite a bit but my thin wayfarer frame causes no trouble). Cushions look durable as well. Care to be taken if you are wearing these with your room temperature more than 34-35 degrees as your ears may get very warm (warm ears are not a problem it is just more of an annoyance) and also sweat will be soaked by cushions which in long-term could make you to replace cushions within a year or 14 months.Build: All plastic with matte finish. Build to last it seems but don‚Äôt overstretch them as plastic is plastic. Look wise they give a premium-minimalist look.The aux cable is 1.2m long but its build quality is not very good. I fear it will break if somehow it manages to get stuck on a chair arm or some other place so take care.The charging cable is micro usb (no usb type c unfortunately even when this headphone launched in year 2020 ) but charging time is super low: 2hrs for a full charge with a fast charging adapter and ~2.5hrs if connected to a laptop usb port although the charging cable is very short.The headband is cushioned so it does not hurt the top of my head even after wearing the headphones for hours.

I recently purchased the JBL Tune 760NC headphones and have been using them for a few weeks now. Overall, I'm impressed with the sound quality and noise-cancelling capabilities of these headphones, but there are a few drawbacks to consider.Advantages:The noise-cancelling technology on these headphones is excellent. They block out a significant amount of external noise, making them perfect for use in noisy environments like airplanes or busy offices. The sound quality is also fantastic, with clear highs, mids, and lows. The bass is especially impressive, providing a satisfying thump without overpowering the rest of the music.The headphones are also comfortable to wear for extended periods. The ear cups are soft and cushioned, and the headband is adjustable to fit a wide range of head sizes. The battery life is impressive as well, lasting around 35 hours on a single charge with ANC turned on.Disadvantages:One of the main drawbacks of these headphones is that they're quite bulky. They take up a lot of space in a bag or backpack, making them less than ideal for travel.Another thing to note is that the headphones don't come with a carrying case, which is a bit of a letdown considering their size. You'll need to purchase a separate case if you want to protect them while traveling.Overall, I'm happy with my purchase of the JBL Tune 760NC headphones. While they have a few drawbacks, their excellent noise-cancelling and sound quality make them a great choice for anyone looking for a high-quality pair of headphones.

I have been using the headphones (TUNE 760) for more than a month, here is my reviewAt first (2 days of purchasing) I was very disappointed because I felt that the sound quality was very lacking, the base and loudness disappointed me, but after a week, it started to sound very very good, I think it needed a burn period, because this headphone is now sounding very very good for me.Build Quality - the build quality is good, no major issues, the pad is soft.Comfort - the headphone is comfortable, but one issue is that the clamping force is a bit tight, maybe because I have a big head. Another thing is, even though this is an over read headphone it is not that big, so some part of my ear gets a bit uncomfortable after long use, but if u adjust and find the correct comfortable position, you cab wear it for a long time, I watched a 3 hr movie without any issuesBattery - omg, one of the best part of this headphone, claims 50 hr without noise cancellation, I think it lives upto the mark. You don't have to worry about batterySound quality - I'm not an audiophile, let me clear it up. The sound quality I felt was really good and I was very impressed, after the burn in period, so if you are buying this give it at least 1 week before judging it, trust me it really really gets better. The base was not that high, but not lacking also, was upto the mark.Noise cancellation - it wasn't really that great, could slightly reduce the fan noise that's it, I wouldn't say it is useless, but not that bad either, could reduce the noise of tv from next room when I listened to music, so it did came in handy also with noise cancellation the sound quality I felt improved a bit.Conclusion - as I said, I was really disappointed at first with the purchase, thought I wasted the money(6.5k) but now I'm really really enjoyed it, watching movies was the best experience with dolby music profile in my phone. I'd say it is really worth the money if ur looking for a headphone around 7k

Pros:-‚Ä¢Natural Sound Stage With Amazing Highs, Mids & Lows‚Ä¢Adequate Bass (JBL Signature)‚Ä¢Great Battery Backup‚Ä¢Professional Looks‚Ä¢Has A Heft, Which Feels Premium-ish..‚Ä¢Comes With Type C (Fast Charging) & Aux Support‚Ä¢JBL Service Centre Are Widely AvailableCons:-‚Ä¢The First One Which I Received, Is Kind Of Defective. Using this product for 2 weeks. It's a 4.5 star product but not 5 star due to following reasons. I listen to music a lot, watch movies and also plays a lot of games. My experience is given below.Cons.1. Ear comfort ( 4.5 stars )- Although the product is extremely comfortable I have large ears so a little pain is there if I use it for prolonged periods (2 hour +). People with small to medium ear size may not have any problem with this. I will have to remove for a few minutes and then I can continue. The ear cushions are really soft and the comfort is so far the best.2. Adding to the above point - if you are living in a relatively hot area, ears might sweat and may become uncomfortable. My place is 30+ degree Celsius always. In cooler climate the issue is not existing.3. Audio quality is excellent but really minimal buzzing is there for deep bass. This will not be noticeable at all if you are playing music or gaming. For music and audio editing this may be an issue. Not sure if this is only there for my product. I am satisfied with the product so not returning it.4. No next or prev buttons.Pros.1. Extremely long battery life and quick charging. I have been using the product for 4 days without recharging and is a huge plus. Not tested how many hours I get with ANC on but is pretty long. I use the headsets for 5-6 hours daily and is really good. Charging is pretty quick too.2. ANC is really good. While I was traveling it was able to filter most of the traffic noice except really loud noises. People chatting and other noice is not at all audible so Mom might get angry ;)3. Latency is really low. I was able to play pubg mobile with this and latency was almost undetected but it is there.4. Audio quality is superb, bass is pretty good and is the best so far5. Premium build quality. Weight is little high than the cheap plastic and fibre headsets. This one has metal frame.6. Good range.7. Nice fit. Not too tight not too loose.

If you wanna get this for the noise cancellation feature, you might be disappointed. It isolates at the most 60-70% of the noise around. High frequencies, it does not isolate them at all. I mean zero. You'll be able to hear women's voices, car horns, and anything that is high pitched.Coming to the audio itself, absolutely disappointing. This does not sound like a JBL at all. I've had JBL & Infinity products in the past, and their sound is way better to this. Heck, even my Infinity headphones worth 2k sound better than this.And it's not even comfortable on your ears. Not at all.The only good thing about this is the separation of instruments. Absolutely crisp.Every single instrument and every single note is really clear and really crispy. So that always used to put a smile on my face. But then the other things would dampen my mood soon enough.So be careful before buying this. Consider what you want. Or save up more and go for Sony instead.

These headphones are a little disorienting, and I can explain. I was a bit skeptical on what the ANC would be like on budget headphones. And I was right.The first thing I noticed when I tried these on was the kind of seal around the ears. It creates this vacuum-like effect where it feels like all the air in and around your ears have been sucked out, which could be good for the noise cancelling, but definitely feels strange. And then there is the active noise cancelling itself, which when you turn on, it kind of shuts out the world around you, but only a little bit. It doesn't cancel white noise, it just makes it quieter. I was still able to hear the fan in my room, and my fan is not noisy in the first place. The ANC was a disappointment and made me feel uncomfortable after a while.The sound quality on the other hand, is good. I have used some JBL headphones like the JBL Quantum 600, and these have a sound that is similar to those headphones. It's a typical JBL sound, where there is slightly more emphasis to the bass and treble, but the mids are not completely crushed. So it sounds like the entire range has been amplified. It's a good sound for people who like the presence of good bass, but don't want too much bass.Battery life has been good so far. Do note that these don't come with a carrying case, but the headphones can be folded. They charge via USB-C, they have an audio jack and come with a cable.Overall, these sound good. I just wish the ANC was better.
If you are planning to buy this for Bass or ANC please don't buy this. ANC functioning properly, it can not even filter fan noise and while connecting to many devices ANC doesn't even activate.

This is a first impression review, i could give it a better or weaker review later.as soon as I got my hands on the device, I was impressed by the finish, it looks like it could last a while before wear starts to show, the driver cups are really free and allow for various positions, though they are a bit stiff, compared to the ones I was using.Now for the sound.oddly its got 2 sound modes.......let me elaborateWhen you turn on the headphones for the first time, ANC will be on by default (canceled the sound of the ac and the fans completely )in this mode, the bass is quite good but not overwhelming (if you are a bass head, look for something else, trust me)but if you turn the ANC off, the bass take as nose dive and lands with a bellyflop. It seems to take a step back, and everything is more "open"and on the note of ANC, if you pass 80% volume with ANC on and playing music, the ANC will automatically disable itself and the light will stay on. you will have to turn off the headphones and turn them back on to get the ANC back ......weirdTHIS IS BY NO MEANS BAD THOUGH ......if .....you are not a complete bass head and dont only seek bass (if you want bass more than everything else ......get skull candy crushers)the mids and treble are maintained even if the ANC is off or onPairing is way too easy, its on my PC and phone, but the dual pairing has its fair bit of delay between switching the output (I haven't found the hang of it yet)

It is just 1.5K. 5K headphone is not turning off automatically.

The JBL Tune 760NC showcases an impressive build quality, receiving a perfect score of 5/5. Its durable construction instills confidence in its longevity. However, the active noise cancellation (ANC) disappoints with a subpar 2/5 rating, failing to effectively block out external disturbances. The bass, at 2.5/5, lacks the depth and punch expected for an immersive audio experience. The overall sound quality also falls short at 2.5/5, indicating a lack of balance and nuance. While the sturdy build is commendable, the 760NC's weaknesses in ANC, bass, and sound quality make it difficult to recommend, especially when better alternatives exist within the same category.

Okay so starting with me thinking I had wasted my 4500Rs out in the first week of wearing it where I wasn't really satisfied to realizing that buying these was a great decision, I've started to love these very much.Battery: Dang boi I cant stress the fact enough on how I LOVE its battery , I use it for hours a day and it barely goes 10-20% down. its been 3 weeks and i have charged it maybe only 2 times till nowBluetooth connectivity : it connects almost instantly to my android and the reach is superb , i had a good connection and the song was playing smooth even after being upstairs , distance of about15 mtrs easily is covered. Can connect to 2 devices at a time.Even though 710bt does not have ANC , I like them, there isn't much you can hear after you play a song,The Bass is cool , not too high not too low , there's a lot of clarity in the music , plus with dolby atmos in the phone , I'm having a pretty great experience.Its not tight on the head to me for like atleast maybe 4-5 hrs , but if you wear it longgg enough , yea you'll want to adjust it or remove it completely, but I feel that's pretty much with every headphone right?Just for reference I watched the entire first season of stranger things without removing them once or getting bothered.Umm it bothers a little when you wear it down on the neck cause it is foldable , but i think i figured out something, you can wear the right side on the left one and fold them inside out,Hope all of this helps.

The build isn't great, the plastic is cheap & noisy, teaching you over and over again about trade-offs & sacrifices. There's no ANC so, you'll have to increase the volume to 100% to avoid wedding songs in the gym entering your ears and making sure the dumbbells fall on your face. Bluetooth audio delay is 100 milliseconds, a bother while playing the dinosaur game on Chrome (it makes me nauseous when the jump doesn't time with the sound effects). So, make sure to make the headphones wired before attempting to play. Microphone sound is... who cares. You'll forget about all the problems when you'll play your favorite song for the first time. The sound is as good as my musician friend's Rs. 7k wired headphones by Audio Technica, although a little bass boosted, which would still be too little of a boost for most people, but not for me.

ITEM SENT IN GOOD CONDITIONS. BASS and SOUND QUALITY NOT BAD ACCORDING TO PRICE RANGE ~ BUT PROBLEMS R IN SPECIFICATIONS !!1. LED NOT TURNS BLUE AFTER FULL-CHARGE ~ AS MENTIONED IN MANUAL. SO IT‚Äôs A PROBLEM TO KNOW WHETHER ITS FULLY CHARGED OR NOT IN OFF MODE.2. LED TOO TINY & TOO INDISTINCT & HARDLY VISIBLE DURING CHARGE !! KEEP UR ROOM LIGHT OFF & SEE WHETHER ITS BLUE OR RED !!3. POWER RESUME OPTION SOMETIMES NOT WORKS ~ MEANS EVRYTIME IT STARTS FROM BEGINNING TO PLAY !!4. MEMORY CARD DOES NOT START PLAY AUTOMATICALLY ~ AS MENTIONED IN MANUAL.U HV TO PUSH PLAY BUTTON.5. BUTTONS R VERY MUCH FLAT & INDISTINCT. U HV TO FIND IT LIKE A BLIND PERSON BY TOUCH. SO ITS ALWAYS CONFUSING. MOREOVER NEX & VOLUME BUTTONS R SAME. SO ITS MORE CONFUSING & LITTLE COMPLICATED !!6. COLOUR LOOKING LIKE BRILLIANT RED OR DEEP ORANGE IN PICTURES. BUT ITS ACTUALLY PALE RED ~ WHICH I DISLIKE VERY MUCH. KIDS & CHILDISH FOLKS LIKE THIS COLOUR USUALLY.A BRAND Or A COMPANY SHOULD B MORE CAREFUL OF ALL THIS THINGS.IT SEEMS FUNCTIONERIES DEZINERS OF THIS BRAND OR COMPANY R NOT RICH-THOUGHT OR WELL-SENSITIVE. THEY R JUST MARKETING PEOPLE !!7. THE RIGHT SIDE STRETCH-LOCK IS LITTLE LOOSE. IT ALWAYS COMES OUT 1 / 2 NOTCHES DURING LISTENING.8. IN MEMORY CARD MODE ~ ITS A PROBLEM TO PAIR BLUTUTH. U NEED TO POWER IT OFF THEN PAIR AGAIN !!9. BLUETOOTH VERSION MENTIONED IN AMAZON ~ VERSION 5. WHERE MANUAL SAYS ~ ITS 4.2 !WHATEVER IT IS ~ IT HAS 1 / 2 SECONDS DELAY IN VIDEO PLAY !! SO DELICATE PROBLEMs FOR GAMERS & MUSICIANS !!10. AS BECAUSE BODY COLOR IS BLACK ~ ITS A PROBLEM TO FIND THE PORT & WHOLE DURING PLUG OR JACK IN !!DEZINERS AGAIN PROVED ~ NONSENSE & SENSELESS !!PLAYBACK INTERVALS 2 SECONDS IS OPTIMUM ~ ACCORDING TO ME. BUT I FIND IT IRREGULAR MAXIMUM TIME.>> SO I RETURN THE PRODUCT !!

But on heavy workload, it will last around 2-2.5 hours.8- Lookwise it is good.9- lifetime windows 11 home.Cons:1- Although display is antiglare FHD. It's not IPS, so it looks crisp but average. It's just ok for the purpose of coding or regular tasks where we just want the work to be done. Since viewing angle are bad, so for entertainment, it's good for single person for watching movies but not for multiple people. Display is not good for graphic designer who needs color accuracy.2- There is no backlit keyboard. So, if you want backlit, connect external keyboard with backlit.3- Although it has an SSD, I didn't find the boot time to be faster. It is fast but didn't meet my expectations.4- Graphic card is not dedicated which is just good for normal work. I don't think you will enjoy gaming on it. It can play light games but surely you won't enjoy gaming on such system. And it won't able to play high demanding games.5- Doesn't have activated ms office. You will have to buy it's keys.Note:You can install a separate harddisk (HDD) for storing data. Screws are provided with laptop.For me, the bottom side became very hot and fans started making noise, when it first arrived and I was installing windows updates on it first used it on my bed, that is without proper ventilation. But with proper air flow, it doesn't heat.Conclusion:If you are limited on budget and only want your work to be done and doesn't care much about display quality or back lit keyboard or you aren't a gamer, you can buy it.And if you already bought it, don't regret your decision. It's a ok laptop for most of the task and will get your work done.

If one is looking for a excellent value for money then go for this laptop. Especially if the work to be done is browsing, youtube, office applications (spreadsheets/word/presentations/notes), documents etc. Small time games are also good on this but do not expect to tear through any Frame rates for Valorant or Fortnite or Halo or Call of Duty. This is not the target audience for this laptop.If work related to ML and Large datasets is desired to be conducted on this laptop then please note this will not be as fast as the latest i5 or i7 or AMD Ryzen 7 or Ryzen 6 but compared to other i3 and AMD Ryzen 3 this will perform much better.Basically the need for a powerful laptop or desktop is going away. Unless one is into heavy gaming or working with humongous data sets or require 6-8 hrs or battery backup. Also for gaming the power and performance that game consoles, Sony PS + MS XBox, offer are simply too good. Save some money in buying laptops and go for tablets from Samsung and Apple.The pros are given below followed by Cons1) It comes in with DDR4-3200 8GB RAM in a single slot. It has two slots and can be upgraded to 32GB. This will keep this laptop working for atleast 4-6 years. Again no other laptop at this price range offers this capability.2) Its CPU is about 2 years old but in this price range, i.e. Rs 30000/- it simply blows everything away. Including latest gen competing offerings from AMD and even the latest generation offerings from Intel. Basically its graphics helps which is again better than the latest gen offerings from intel at the same price bracket.3) It is light.4) It has 2 USB 2.0 ports, one USB-C port and one USB 3.0 port along with HDMI and RJ-45 network connection. Again no laptop at this price point has this many combination of the ports.5) It does not come with any bloatware apart from a few Acer utilities. Other laptops from competing brands come with a lot of bloatware and not required software.6) It has PCI 4.0 inside, again no competing model in this price range has this or higher value. So if one upgrades to a good RAM with good CL and a blazing fast SSD this should have a excellent price-to-performance.Now for the Cons1) Viewing angles of the screen are not that good. The screen needs to be at least 115 degrees or more to be viewed properly. Otherwise the colours are washed out.2) Its Battery has not been tested so cannot confirm.3) Its port placements is bad. Majority of users are right handed. But the USB 3.0 and USB-C ports are on the right. Ideally the MicroSD card slot, SIM Card slot as well as Lock port should be on the right with all the USB ports and HDMI on the left. There is a reason why Apple has done something similar on its laptops.4) It has a full sized 101/105 keyboard. This is the era of small keyboard. There is no need to give such a full sized keyboard. If someone needs an additional numeric keyboard there bluetooth and wired USB ones available.

I had the opportunity to use the HP 15s 11th Generation Intel i3 laptop for a while, and I must say that it is a pretty decent machine. While it may not be the most powerful laptop out there, it is certainly a good choice for everyday use.The laptop is equipped with an 11th Generation Intel i3 processor, which is fast enough for most tasks such as web browsing, word processing, and watching videos. The 15.6-inch Full HD display is bright and clear, and the colors are vibrant. The keyboard is comfortable to type on, and the touchpad is responsive and accurate.One thing I really appreciate about this laptop is its design. It has a sleek and modern look with a slim profile, making it easy to carry around. The build quality is solid, and it feels sturdy in your hand. The laptop also has a good selection of ports, including USB-A, USB-C, HDMI, and a headphone jack, which makes it easy to connect to external devices.Another aspect of this laptop that I like is its battery life. The laptop has a decent battery life, lasting around 7-8 hours on a single charge. This is good enough for a full day's work or study without having to worry about finding a power outlet.However, there are a few downsides to this.the laptop's performance may be lacking if you plan to use it for more demanding tasks such as gaming or video editing.Overall, I would give the HP 15s 11th Generation Intel i3 laptop a four-star rating. It is a good laptop for everyday use, with a sleek design, solid build quality, decent performance, and good battery life. However, it may not be the best choice for users who need more storage or require high-performance computing.

1. Websites and web apps opening as mobile version instead of web version due to small screen size. No option to control / increase screen resolution to fix this. This is a major drawback. I mean to browse a mobile site we will use a mobile right?2. They should have pre-recharged the sim card for 5 years. Why would I pay for recharging an extra simcard continuously? Especially when I'm not making calls from it?3. Trackpad is too much touch sensitive - clicks when not clicked. No option to control it or turn off some given gestures. Looks like I have to buy a separate mouse now.4. Provided chatbot feature is currently useless.5. Charger is not type B or type C so no inter-operability. Have to buy a new one once this goes off.6. Sound quality could have been better.I would say that though it's a good attempt in making something between a mobile and a laptop, it looks to be still in the works. Though it would be great if Jio listens to this feedback and provides fixes via software upgrades; open to updating this review if they do.

What i like:* The laptop seems to be on the lighter side and it's a good thing.* The top cover is metallic and feels durable* Lenovo laptop keyboard are nice to type and the fonts and the layout are perfect.* Integrated fingerprint sensor on the Powerbutton is very convenient and i prefer more than the one present on the touchpad.* Battery life is also good and will try to update after months of used.* Speaker are also decent for media.* Screen bezels are also slim and it looks a little bit smaller compare to mi notebook 14.* Touchpad is large and accurate.* Presence of physical webcam shutter is a bonus point.What i didn't like:* Display colour accuracy is on the lower side, but it's what to expect on this price range. It's good for media consumption but don't rely on for colour works.* Sound lack low tones* wish that it support type c charging.

This is the perfect laptop I was searching for my daily tasks and office work as it has everything I wanted i.e. 512 GB SSD, 8 GB RAM (expandable upto 12 GB), backlit keyboard, Fingerprint sensor etc.The only thing which was confusing me was the difference between all the four models which are listed.To keep it simple, don't purchase the model with the highest price i.e. 82H700UYIN, as I found no such difference between 82H700UYIN (highest price) and 82H701DKIN (priced just below the 1st one).Besides this, if you want to consider the lower two variants i.e. 82H700V2IN & 82H701DMIN, than you can go for it.Just the difference you'll find will be clock speed and expandability of RAM and one or two more differences. Just check thoroughly the specs.And if you are thinking of buying top varaint then it will be waste of few thousand rupees. But if you find or know any difference between those two high priced variants the please reply to my review.

It's not bad, but not good either. I bought it for 38,990. I was getting the same price for some other acer laptop with intel i5 1155g7 processor and IPS display, but I missed the deal. So, I bought this ‚òπÔ∏è.Pros:1- Performance is not an issue. Decent performance for most of the tasks.2- Didn't do gaming, so not sure of that. But for programming, it's good.3- Good for multitasking.4- Audio is good. It's not loud, but sufficient and it comes with Nahimic audio (for which you will have to download it's app) which enhances it's audio capabilities. Audio can be optimised for different purpose.5- Sufficient ports. Also have type C port.6- It has control center to control fan speed, external keyboard light, manage fan speed, power.7- Battery is decent and can last 4-5 hours on regular workload. But on heavy workload, it will last around 2-2.5 hours.8- Lookwise it is good.9- lifetime windows 11 home.Cons:1- Although display is antiglare FHD. It's not IPS, so it looks crisp but average. It's just ok for the purpose of coding or regular tasks where we just want the work to be done. Since viewing angle are bad, so for entertainment, it's good for single person for watching movies but not for multiple people. Display is not good for graphic designer who needs color accuracy.2- There is no backlit keyboard. So, if you want backlit, connect external keyboard with backlit.3- Although it has an SSD, I didn't find the boot time to be faster. It is fast but didn't meet my expectations.4- Graphic card is not dedicated which is just good for normal work. I don't think you will enjoy gaming on it. It can play light games but surely you won't enjoy gaming on such system. And it won't able to play high demanding games.5- Doesn't have activated ms office. You will have to buy it's keys.Note:You can install a separate harddisk (HDD) for storing data. Screws are provided with laptop.For me, the bottom side became very hot and fans started making noise, when it first arrived and I was installing windows updates on it first used it on my bed, that is without proper ventilation. But with proper air flow, it doesn't heat.Conclusion:If you are limited on budget and only want your work to be done and doesn't care much about display quality or back lit keyboard or you aren't a gamer, you can buy it.And if you already bought it, don't regret your decision. It's a ok laptop for most of the task and will get your work done.

This the the best laptop under 100k. I have been using this for more then 6 months now, and did not face any hardware issue yet. Also it's thermals are unbelievable, even at 90% loads on cpu and gpu temps were below 80 degrees which is awesome.

the overall laptop comes with artx 3060rysen 5 5600h16 gb ram (single channel)240gb ssd and 1tb hddthese specifications are prefect for gaming, video editing or 3d rendering at this price rangethe battery lasted for more than 4.7 hrs with battery saver on and 3.5 hrs without battery saver.batter saver wasn't a big problem cause laptop worked rly smooth for extended battery life run the display at 60hz.the rtx 3060 has a base clock of 900mhz and boost clock of 1.43ghz well with the acer optimized plan the boost clock went till 1900+ mhz which is pretty good. Title: The MSI GF63 Gaming Laptop - A True Gaming Powerhouse!I recently purchased the MSI GF63 gaming laptop, and I must say, it has completely exceeded my expectations in every way possible. This laptop is an absolute game-changer, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.Performance:The MSI GF63 is a beast when it comes to performance. With its powerful Intel Core i7 processor and NVIDIA GeForce GTX graphics card, it handles even the most demanding games and applications with ease. I've experienced buttery-smooth gameplay and lightning-fast load times, making my gaming experience truly immersive.Design:The laptop's sleek and modern design is not only aesthetically pleasing but also practical. It's incredibly thin and lightweight, making it easy to carry around. The slim bezel display provides an immersive visual experience, and the backlit keyboard is not only comfortable for long gaming sessions but also adds a cool factor to the laptop's overall look.Display:The 15.6-inch Full HD display is nothing short of stunning. The colors are vibrant, and the sharpness of the images is impressive. Whether I'm gaming, watching movies, or working on creative projects, the display never disappoints.Cooling:One of the standout features of this laptop is its excellent cooling system. It manages to keep the laptop cool even during intense gaming sessions, thanks to MSI's innovative cooling technology. This ensures that the laptop runs smoothly without any overheating issues.Battery Life:Considering its gaming prowess, the battery life is surprisingly good. I can get several hours of productivity or entertainment on a single charge, making it versatile for both work and play.Audio:The audio quality on the MSI GF63 is exceptional. The built-in speakers deliver clear and immersive sound, and the Nahimic audio enhancer software allows for customizable audio profiles, enhancing the gaming and multimedia experience.Price:Considering the high-end components and top-notch performance, the MSI GF63 offers incredible value for its price. It competes with laptops that are much more expensive but still manages to outperform them in many aspects.In conclusion, the MSI GF63 gaming laptop has won me over completely. It's a powerhouse of performance, style, and value. Whether you're a hardcore gamer or a professional looking for a reliable and versatile laptop, the MSI GF63 is undoubtedly one of the best choices on the market. okay got the ultra today and the display is not as amazing as advertised imho. It is extremely sharp (thanks to the 2000p display!) but not at all color accurate. So over saturated that it gives mi and realme phone camera vibes lol. Another example after the iPhone 11 that proves higher resolution != better display.I have an old hp pavilion 14 x360 (14inch 1080p), LG 22MK600M monitor (22 inch IPS LCD 1080p), Lenovo L24i-30 monitor (24 inch IPS LCD 1080p) to compare with and have to say color reproduction is not at all natural on the Mi laptop. And yeah it is the worst of the 4 with Lenovo at 3rd HP 2nd and LG the best. I tested with the famous costa rica 4k video and the greens and yellows on the snake at 0: 07 are so so poor that it almost feels like one bright green. Even looking at the long shots of the trees you can tell the display is so over saturated. Especially looking side by side with others, the differences could easily be spotted (tbh there's no need to look side by side either. you can tell easily, unless you're coming from a TN panel).However everything else about the laptop is great (would've loved ryzen but it's okay considering intel iris xe). 16GB ram with i5 is a combination most tasks find useful but rarely available. Quality of life features like Battery life, thunderbolt, type-c charging, fp scanner, large track-pad and better than average keyboard (I'm used to mechanical so can't appreciate much). Restart takes like 15sec max. wake up from sleep is instant. excellent build (although my hp x360 is good too, so it's not as 'awe'ing to me). the hinge is so satisfying. It's all top notch. Only display didn't reach the expectation.

I have been using this laptop for last 10 months, I bought it after 1 month after releasing it, Buying a laptop is a huge deal in middle-class family, so I took time to decide it to buy the best I was going to buy (lenovo IdeaPad Slim 5 AMD Ryzen 5 5500U 15.6 inches FHD IPS Thin and Light Business Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office/Backlit Keyboard/Fingerprint Reader/Graphite Grey/1.66Kg) I was almost finalised it to buy, I also talked with the offline seller but then this beast launched which have almost same specs with upgraded bluetooth 5.2 and wifi 6 and a thunderbolt with lower price and the best part for me " 3.2k resolution 100% srgb display ", the build quality is like best of the best, the screen is so good, thin and with the small bezels it looks damn sexy........for me it's a perfect choice.......well enough pros now one con which I don't like about this laptop is its BAD SPEAKERS, which is really bad but that's okay for me , i bought realme buds air 2 at 2800rs ( great deal) from there my journey with my first and best laptop started..

This is my Honest Opinion on the Product. Btw, I am a big fan of Xiaomi. Never had bad experience with their mobile, speaker etc except one from the TV.* Display : It is good. But it is not great as mentioned. Contrast could be better. Whites are too bright. Not comfortable to read. Color is definitely not accurate.* Performance : It is good.* Track Pad: Total Crap. Not pleasant to work. It make horrible sound at times and only the center area works consistent.* Speakers : You mean this laptop has inbuilt speakers ? I doubt. Please stay away from this product if you cant use headphone or bluetooth speaker with this product. Of all the mobiles, laptops, tablets I used in my life, definitely this could be the one having worst speaker.* Build : It is built good. It looks like Mac. (It only looks). Mac build quality is far superior.* Battery: You could get 4 to 5 hours. I dont understand how company claims 10/12 hours. Charging speed is only average and not very fast. It takes ages to charge when you use the laptop.* Keyboard: Yes. It has keyboard and you can type :-)I have office MAC and a 3 years old 25K dell i3 laptop along with this. My satisfaction with this product is no way near to any of my previous windows laptops.These companies should be sued for horribly wrong descriptions like 12 hours battery when you cant even get 5 hours, DTS Audio when you cant even hear anything from the speakers etc.

Bought the Mi Ultra laptop during the first sale on 31st Aug. Extremely disappointed with the laptop as well as Mi Support.12/09: Laptop doesn't turn on anymore. It has been 10 days, so cannot even return it. On the 6th day, the laptop went into a continuous restart loop which I fixed with hard shut down 3 times after watching some YouTube videos. And then it was working okay for 2 days. Now it doesn't even start. The charge light also doesn't come on. Nothing happens on pressing the power button. Nothing happens when you connect the charger. It's dead. Need to take it to the service center just 10 days into the purchase! Don't buy this, all the great specs are useless if it doesn't start!Update 13/09: I gave it for service and they are saying the battery and motherboard is defective and they need to replace it! I'm shocked. It's a brand new laptop and in 10 days the battery and motherboard is gone? How can that happen? I've hardly even used it! And they also say that since it's a new laptop the parts are taking time to come to the service center! Better to buy a reliable HP, Dell, Lenovo laptop even if it's a bit more expensive!Update 20/09: It has been with Mi service center for 8 days now. Everytime I call them they say it will get fixed in 2 days. On probing further they said there is a hardware problem. The battery and motherboard needs to be replaced! Wow I can't understand how the battery and motherboard can have problems in just 10 days of purchase? It's clearly a manufacturing defect from Xiaomi. They say they have ordered the parts but they haven't received it since it's a new model! Unbelievable!Just lost lot of money and peace with this laptop! Don't trust Xiaomi from now.23/09: They called me from the service center and asked me to collect a replacement laptop. I got a brand new laptop unopened and I opened it and checked in the service center itself. It seems that they couldn't fix the old laptop and had to send it back, so I got lucky. Else, I would have got a repaired one.Anyway, I'm happy I got a new replacement laptop and currently it's working well.

I bought the product with configuration of i5, 16gb RAM, 512 SSD, and here is my review after the first day use:1) Display:Display of the laptop is excellent. I was looking for one with a good display that will help me work without the monitor connected.2) Battery:With a moderate use, battery performance on the first day was really good. I worked for nearly 5 hours (out of which 2 hrs of zoom calls) and 50% drained.3) Camera:Camera is just fine for video calls, not bad actually as it's used mainly for video conferences or online classes etc.4) Speakers:Inbuilt speakers are fine for the above mentioned uses. I felt it's more effective when it's kept on a surface than we keep it on lap.5) Performance:Performance wise there is not much notable difference from those of others with the same specification3) Others:Fingerprint, keyboard, mouse pad are also impressive in the first instance.My take: Overall a good, worthy and budget friendly product when compared to those in the same category!Thanks to Amazon too, to deliver it quickly and to give an option to buy for a day when the stock is up

okay got the ultra today and the display is not as amazing as advertised imho. It is extremely sharp (thanks to the 2000p display!) but not at all color accurate. So over saturated that it gives mi and realme phone camera vibes lol. Another example after the iPhone 11 that proves higher resolution != better display.I have an old hp pavilion 14 x360 (14inch 1080p), LG 22MK600M monitor (22 inch IPS LCD 1080p), Lenovo L24i-30 monitor (24 inch IPS LCD 1080p) to compare with and have to say color reproduction is not at all natural on the Mi laptop. And yeah it is the worst of the 4 with Lenovo at 3rd HP 2nd and LG the best. I tested with the famous costa rica 4k video and the greens and yellows on the snake at 0: 07 are so so poor that it almost feels like one bright green. Even looking at the long shots of the trees you can tell the display is so over saturated. Especially looking side by side with others, the differences could easily be spotted (tbh there's no need to look side by side either. you can tell easily, unless you're coming from a TN panel).However everything else about the laptop is great (would've loved ryzen but it's okay considering intel iris xe). 16GB ram with i5 is a combination most tasks find useful but rarely available. Quality of life features like Battery life, thunderbolt, type-c charging, fp scanner, large track-pad and better than average keyboard (I'm used to mechanical so can't appreciate much). Restart takes like 15sec max. wake up from sleep is instant. excellent build (although my hp x360 is good too, so it's not as 'awe'ing to me). the hinge is so satisfying. It's all top notch. Only display didn't reach the expectation.

I have been using this laptop for last 10 months, I bought it after 1 month after releasing it, Buying a laptop is a huge deal in middle-class family, so I took time to decide it to buy the best I was going to buy (lenovo IdeaPad Slim 5 AMD Ryzen 5 5500U 15.6 inches FHD IPS Thin and Light Business Laptop (16GB/512GB SSD/Windows 10/MS Office/Backlit Keyboard/Fingerprint Reader/Graphite Grey/1.66Kg) I was almost finalised it to buy, I also talked with the offline seller but then this beast launched which have almost same specs with upgraded bluetooth 5.2 and wifi 6 and a thunderbolt with lower price and the best part for me " 3.2k resolution 100% srgb display ", the build quality is like best of the best, the screen is so good, thin and with the small bezels it looks damn sexy........for me it's a perfect choice.......well enough pros now one con which I don't like about this laptop is its BAD SPEAKERS, which is really bad but that's okay for me , i bought realme buds air 2 at 2800rs ( great deal) from there my journey with my first and best laptop started..

This is my Honest Opinion on the Product. Btw, I am a big fan of Xiaomi. Never had bad experience with their mobile, speaker etc except one from the TV.* Display : It is good. But it is not great as mentioned. Contrast could be better. Whites are too bright. Not comfortable to read. Color is definitely not accurate.* Performance : It is good.* Track Pad: Total Crap. Not pleasant to work. It make horrible sound at times and only the center area works consistent.* Speakers : You mean this laptop has inbuilt speakers ? I doubt. Please stay away from this product if you cant use headphone or bluetooth speaker with this product. Of all the mobiles, laptops, tablets I used in my life, definitely this could be the one having worst speaker.* Build : It is built good. It looks like Mac. (It only looks). Mac build quality is far superior.* Battery: You could get 4 to 5 hours. I dont understand how company claims 10/12 hours. Charging speed is only average and not very fast. It takes ages to charge when you use the laptop.* Keyboard: Yes. It has keyboard and you can type :-)I have office MAC and a 3 years old 25K dell i3 laptop along with this. My satisfaction with this product is no way near to any of my previous windows laptops.These companies should be sued for horribly wrong descriptions like 12 hours battery when you cant even get 5 hours, DTS Audio when you cant even hear anything from the speakers etc.

Bought the Mi Ultra laptop during the first sale on 31st Aug. Extremely disappointed with the laptop as well as Mi Support.12/09: Laptop doesn't turn on anymore. It has been 10 days, so cannot even return it. On the 6th day, the laptop went into a continuous restart loop which I fixed with hard shut down 3 times after watching some YouTube videos. And then it was working okay for 2 days. Now it doesn't even start. The charge light also doesn't come on. Nothing happens on pressing the power button. Nothing happens when you connect the charger. It's dead. Need to take it to the service center just 10 days into the purchase! Don't buy this, all the great specs are useless if it doesn't start!Update 13/09: I gave it for service and they are saying the battery and motherboard is defective and they need to replace it! I'm shocked. It's a brand new laptop and in 10 days the battery and motherboard is gone? How can that happen? I've hardly even used it! And they also say that since it's a new laptop the parts are taking time to come to the service center! Better to buy a reliable HP, Dell, Lenovo laptop even if it's a bit more expensive!Update 20/09: It has been with Mi service center for 8 days now. Everytime I call them they say it will get fixed in 2 days. On probing further they said there is a hardware problem. The battery and motherboard needs to be replaced! Wow I can't understand how the battery and motherboard can have problems in just 10 days of purchase? It's clearly a manufacturing defect from Xiaomi. They say they have ordered the parts but they haven't received it since it's a new model! Unbelievable!Just lost lot of money and peace with this laptop! Don't trust Xiaomi from now.23/09: They called me from the service center and asked me to collect a replacement laptop. I got a brand new laptop unopened and I opened it and checked in the service center itself. It seems that they couldn't fix the old laptop and had to send it back, so I got lucky. Else, I would have got a repaired one.Anyway, I'm happy I got a new replacement laptop and currently it's working well.

I bought the product with configuration of i5, 16gb RAM, 512 SSD, and here is my review after the first day use:1) Display:Display of the laptop is excellent. I was looking for one with a good display that will help me work without the monitor connected.2) Battery:With a moderate use, battery performance on the first day was really good. I worked for nearly 5 hours (out of which 2 hrs of zoom calls) and 50% drained.3) Camera:Camera is just fine for video calls, not bad actually as it's used mainly for video conferences or online classes etc.4) Speakers:Inbuilt speakers are fine for the above mentioned uses. I felt it's more effective when it's kept on a surface than we keep it on lap.5) Performance:Performance wise there is not much notable difference from those of others with the same specification3) Others:Fingerprint, keyboard, mouse pad are also impressive in the first instance.My take: Overall a good, worthy and budget friendly product when compared to those in the same category!Thanks to Amazon too, to deliver it quickly and to give an option to buy for a day when the stock is up

Pros- armory crate to manage the over clocking- good thermals with 3 fans that go upto 7k RPM- Good display when not on HDR- Unmatched performance for both CPU and GPU- soft keyboard without noise- bios features are very nice, especially the CPU undervolting option and the selective performance and efficiency core turn on/off- Good battery life, upto 5 hours on max efficiency mode, 2 hours on performance mode with low gfx. You will have to configure the code count and cou+gpu wattage manual from armory crate to get best results.- Built qualit is very nice, fells like it was thought through, avoiding unnecessary metal keeps the weight down aswell.Cons- Mini LED Display is a let down, glitchy firmware causing screen to go blank/crash very frequently when using dedicated GPU mode. Even when it works, the HDR is not very good, 1000 is too less atleast 4000 mini led required for it to be meaning ful, either opt for non mini led ot OLED.- wifi chip could have been better, like the killer pro, it's not bad by any means but, for a SCAR series I expected better.- boot up time is surprisingly slow 8-10 secs- the huge power adapter with 16 Amp socket is difficult to plugin in public places if you travel.Verdict- Really good product from Asus, suits all my Development and Gaming needs with butter smooth ease.- get the model without the mini led, this feels like a gimmick, not worth the extra 10k, i certainly keep it turned off.

I recently got my hands on the Asus ROG Strix Scar 16 2023, and to say I'm impressed would be an understatement. This laptop redefines what it means to have power and performance in a portable package.Price: ‚Çπ2.85LUnleashing the Beast: At the core of this technological marvel lies an i9-13980HX processor that effortlessly handles anything you throw at it. From resource-intensive tasks to demanding gaming sessions, this laptop doesn't break a sweat. The 32GB of RAM ensures smooth multitasking, even with multiple applications running simultaneously.Graphics Prowess: The RTX 4080 12GB graphics card is an absolute game-changer. It's not just about the numbers; it's about the experience. Whether I'm diving into the latest AAA titles or tackling content creation tasks, the graphics are nothing short of breathtaking. Every pixel is a testament to the engineering excellence that Asus brings to the table.A Display That Dazzles: The Mini LED-QHD+ display is a treat for the eyes. The colors pop, and the details are sharp and vivid. Whether I'm editing photos, binge-watching my favorite shows, or immersing myself in the gaming world, this display elevates every visual experience.Storage Galore: With a 1TB SSD, storage concerns are a thing of the past. Lightning-fast load times and ample space for my projects and games make this laptop a true workhorse.Design and Build: The sleek and futuristic design of the laptop is a head-turner. The build quality is robust, and the keyboard, complete with per-key RGB lighting, adds a touch of personalization. The laptop's thermal management system deserves special mention; even during intense gaming sessions, the temperatures are impressively controlled.Final Verdict: The Asus ROG Strix Scar 16 2023 is a powerhouse that redefines what a laptop can achieve. It's not just about specs on paper; it's about a seamless and immersive user experience. Whether you're a professional, a gamer, or simply someone who values top-tier technology, this laptop is a game-changer.Pros:Unparalleled performance with i9 processor and RTX 4080 graphics.Stunning display with Mini LED-QHD+ technology.Ample storage and lightning-fast SSD.Thoughtful design and build quality.Efficient thermal management.Cons:The sheer power might be overkill for casual users.Price can be optimized a but.In a world where power and innovation collide, the Asus ROG Strix Scar 16 2023 emerges as a true champion. This laptop has set a new standard for what's possible in the realm of portable computing. If you're ready to experience the future of technology, don't hesitate to make this investment. It's not just a laptop; it's a masterpiece.

When I don't connect the charger it works very slow. But when I connect the charger it works fast. Can you tell me what is the reason? And location for the service centre.

This laptop has been built that such that without the charger plugged in (AC INPUT), the CPU is slowed (throttled) to 400 Mhz. Basically rendering this laptop useless without a charger. Not even Windows 7 will run on this without a charger.You cannot override this setting as it is at the chip level.They have also instituted h2O Bios, where we have limited control over the product.For a country like India where the power can leave at any point.This product is useless without a constant power supply.This is a poor build, and it seems like ACER lazily reapplied some chip settings they had designed for another product on this one without any quality checks.

REDEFINES BUDGET LAPTOPSReview Date: May 24, 2022VERDICT: DEFINITE BUY.SUMMARY: Score: 9.0/10.Back with HP after 14 years and loving it!This is an excellent laptop that redefines what budget laptops offer. Looks, features, performance and battery life- all at a different level. Rivals laptops that retailed at 50k just a few months back. This is only the 3rd time in 20 years that something has felt like a REAL upgrade in technology (first was Ahtlon 64, next was affordable SSDs, and now this).Additionally, nowadays, you get Windows and Office free for the device‚Äôs life. Solid hardware specs and useful software pre-loaded means a complete laptop that does not need any user expertise in upgrading.USAGE: 3 daysPROCESSES FOLLOWED: 3 full battery cycles, debloating (McAfee, LastPass, some MS games), some power management tweaksREVIEW:Key Laptop components reviewed below with Pros and Cons of each.ÔÉò CASE AND BUILD: 9/10Full plastic. Compact but chunky. Lid is plain. Keyboard panel is brushed finish. Bottom is matte plastic.PROS: Looks good. Compact but chunky. Comfortable to hold.CONS: Plain lid attracts dust and fingerprints.ÔÉò LID: 9/10Black matte finish on the inside. Hinge is firm. No wobble. Opens to approx. 115 deg.PROS: Seems reliable enough.CONS: Single hinge design forces keyboard down, reducing area available for trackpad.ÔÉò KEYBOARD: 9/10Backlit (2 levels). Separate paging keys. Lights for Caps Lock and Audio Off (no idea why).PROS: Keys slightly scalloped, offering good hold. Separate paging keys are a life saver when working in Excel. Two Stage backlight. Tactile (but little mushy). Give it 1-2 days to break in.CONS: Slightly noisy when typing fast. No dedicated function keys for Mic Off/ Sleep. Power button is recessed, causing some misses when pressing.ÔÉò TRACKPAD: 7/10Area seems 16+:9 (like current smartphones). Slightly rough texture. Slight rattle when tapping. But way more reliable and smooth than Asus‚Äô touchpads.PROs: Smooth and accurate tracking.CONs: Tapping is very uncomfortable (due to the clattering noise)- so dragging may not be comfortable.ÔÉò SCREEN: 9/10Glossy screen. Gives sharp text and good contrast. Can use 14‚Äù at 100% scaling (or for older guys) 115%.PROs: Bright. Excellent contrast. Text is sharp and readable.CONs: Contrast and colour balance drop off below 80% brightness.ÔÉò PORTS: 8/101 SD Card reader (full size), 1x HDMI, 2xUSB3-A, 1xUSB-C, 1x3.5mm.PROs: Strong suite of ports.CONs: All (except SD Card) are on the right side. Using a mouse is a pain.ÔÉò UPGRADABILITY: 9/10PROs: 2 separate RAM slots (have not opened, checked from reviews).CONs: At least 4 screws are located under the 2 rubber pads. Not user upgradeable.ÔÉò SOFTWARE: 10/10Windows 11 Home. System Encryption is available. Office H&S 2021 for life. A few bloatware- McAfee, LastPass and some Windows games. Easy to uninstall.ÔÉò PERFORMANCE: 10/10The Ryzen 3 5300U is freakishly fast! Cannot believe this level of performance at ‚Çπ40k. Launching apps, multi-tasking, etc.- all effortless.PROs: Super-powerful CPU. Stays cool. Also easy to control turbo in Windows 11 (unlike Ryzen 3 3250U)- setting Max CPU level at 99% limits speed to 2.6GHz. Under normal usage (setting up laptop, indexing, etc.) in peak Delhi summer in non-AC room, CPU temp was 45-55 deg C (Asus‚Äô Ryzen 3 3250 model runs at 80+ deg C). Keyboard stays cool.CONs: Fan response seems slow. Stays quiet for some time, suddenly ramps up to a single speed for some minutes and slows down again. Small distraction.ÔÉò BATTERY: 10/10Battery is rated at 41.050Wh. Max was at 41.005Wh. Battery is the older higher voltage kind (11-13V), compared to the newer 8V ones. But my experience with older batteries has been much better. The newer ones dropped off faster after about 3 years. And usage of the same components would help HP keep costs in check. So no complaints.PROs: Excellent battery life. With some basic tweaks, power usage in normal situations is between 3-5W, giving a battery backup of 8Hrs-10+Hrs. I don‚Äôt think you can ask for anything more. Compare this with Asus‚Äô Ryzen 3 3250U model where I had to do N things to get heat and battery backup to acceptable levels. I did not have to do anything special here.CONs: Imagine what would happen if HP gave a 56Whr battery- who needs a MacBook?COMPARED TO ASUS:Asus has been the leader in laptop innovations- bringing in Full HD and dual storage to budget laptops. I have 2 Asus systems. But of late they have started skimping in important areas-ÔÉò Semi-passive cooling leads to higher temperatures and frequent throttling of CPUs even in normal usages. Keyboards become uncomfortably hot.ÔÉò Screens are matte (useful), but have very low contrast (text is harder to read when documents are zoomed out).ÔÉò HDD installation kits are cheap and flimsy. I‚Äôve seen in 2 cases where the cheap cable causes data transfer errors and Windows crashes as well (for the record, I have Windows 10/11 in 4 PCs from 1st Gen Intel to 7th Gen- and there was not a single crash in any of them).When I bought a new Asus Vivobook a few months back, it was a big disappointment. I felt like I was back in the Windows XP days when I used to spend hours trying to get things to work. This HP has been a very good experience. Fully specced, well configured and works as it should.

I bought this laptop on summer sale. Here is the review after 2-3 weeks of usage.Pros:1. Budget - Bought this laptop for 32K after discounts.2. Processor - Ryzen 3 with 4 cores with 16GB of RAM.3. MS office with lifetime validity.4. Screen quality is excellent.5. Light weight - Weights around 1.5 KG, which is very easy to carry for daily use.6. Battery backup - On an average battery with stands for 6 to 8 hours after full charge (Continuously browsing, doing office work).7. Screen size - 14 inch which is easy to carry.8. Boot time - Takes around 8 to 10 seconds to reach login screen (Win 11 is pre-installed)9. Track pad is precise and responsive.10. Keys are large enough to hold & press. Battery indicator is placed next to the charging port, sometimes it is quite difficult to find the laptop is charged or still charging.2. Build quality is average, sometimes I feel like keys not aligned properly.3. Warranty registration - Experienced difficulties to register for warranty with HP site. HP Support website is not designed intuitively or not self-explanatory.This laptop is ideal for college students and daily use. Don't expect this laptop to run heavy software's and Games.

I was having nearly three months of research to find out a best laptop for both personal and professional use that comes within a range of 40 to 60 K. HP 14s is the one which I concluded at last . After 2 weeks of experience I'm writing this review. The laptop works in a smooth way without any glitches and trouble.System Info :Model: HP 14s - FqOS : Windows 11. (X64)Processor : AMD Ryzen 5500 with 6 core and 12 logical processor. Base speed 2.1 Mhz and 4 Mhz with turbo boost.Graphic : AMD Radeon Graphics.RAM : 8 GB (Upgradeable).Drive memory: 512 SSD.Chipset : AMD Integrated SocWeb cam : 720 p Hd with dual microphone.Display : Full HD with thin basal, 60 Hz refresh state and 250 nits brightness. 14 inch size.Preinstalled Software: MS office Home and student (Without Outlook ), Mc Cafee antivirus (For one month), Drop Box subscription for 1 year (100nGb), Amazon Alexa.Warranty: 1 year (Extendable).Build Quality: Silver coloured with a metallic texture premium plastic body, with super comfortable key board having back lite ( Withou separate t number key) and a total weight of 1.45 Kg.Battery: 3 Cell ,41 Wh Li-ion .Now lets see the pros and cons which I observed.Pros : Super thin body with think Basel screen and super viewing experience. Light weight and will give you a good sound experience. Web came us fair enough for meetings. Good experience while coding, basic games ,videos, music, typing, and general office and personal use. Exhaust is designed according to the dynamics so the air flow will go upward via next to the screen without effecting the screen at all.Cons : Could have equipped with a privacy shutter for web cam, One thump opening of display is not possible (Cuz of that the weight is not much ), CPU fan sometimes rotate high speed which make a little noise. CPU gets hot a little some time ( But gets normal immediately). Touch pad is plane so it sometime right click become left click if not careful enough.Notes: its comes with 2 USB ports, 1 audio jack port, 1 HDMI port, 1 charging port,1 SD card slot. No finger print reader. But facials recognition is available. 120 degree screen screen adjustment (not 180 or 360 degrees), no touch.So after considering all I experience this machine is really worth the value for money.

If one is looking for a excellent value for money then go for this laptop. Especially if the work to be done is browsing, youtube, office applications (spreadsheets/word/presentations/notes), documents etc. Small time games are also good on this but do not expect to tear through any Frame rates for Valorant or Fortnite or Halo or Call of Duty. This is not the target audience for this laptop.If work related to ML and Large datasets is desired to be conducted on this laptop then please note this will not be as fast as the latest i5 or i7 or AMD Ryzen 7 or Ryzen 6 but compared to other i3 and AMD Ryzen 3 this will perform much better.Basically the need for a powerful laptop or desktop is going away. Unless one is into heavy gaming or working with humongous data sets or require 6-8 hrs or battery backup. Also for gaming the power and performance that game consoles, Sony PS + MS XBox, offer are simply too good. Save some money in buying laptops and go for tablets from Samsung and Apple.The pros are given below followed by Cons1) It comes in with DDR4-3200 8GB RAM in a single slot. It has two slots and can be upgraded to 32GB. This will keep this laptop working for atleast 4-6 years. Again no other laptop at this price range offers this capability.2) Its CPU is about 2 years old but in this price range, i.e. Rs 30000/- it simply blows everything away. Including latest gen competing offerings from AMD and even the latest generation offerings from Intel. Basically its graphics helps which is again better than the latest gen offerings from intel at the same price bracket.3) It is light.4) It has 2 USB 2.0 ports, one USB-C port and one USB 3.0 port along with HDMI and RJ-45 network connection. Again no laptop at this price point has this many combination of the ports.5) It does not come with any bloatware apart from a few Acer utilities. Other laptops from competing brands come with a lot of bloatware and not required software.6) It has PCI 4.0 inside, again no competing model in this price range has this or higher value. So if one upgrades to a good RAM with good CL and a blazing fast SSD this should have a excellent price-to-performance.Now for the Cons1) Viewing angles of the screen are not that good. The screen needs to be at least 115 degrees or more to be viewed properly. Otherwise the colours are washed out.2) Its Battery has not been tested so cannot confirm.3) Its port placements is bad. Majority of users are right handed. But the USB 3.0 and USB-C ports are on the right. Ideally the MicroSD card slot, SIM Card slot as well as Lock port should be on the right with all the USB ports and HDMI on the left. There is a reason why Apple has done something similar on its laptops.4) It has a full sized 101/105 keyboard. This is the era of small keyboard. There is no need to give such a full sized keyboard. If someone needs an additional numeric keyboard there bluetooth and wired USB ones available.

When I don't connect the charger it works very slow. But when I connect the charger it works fast. Can you tell me what is the reason? And location for the service centre.

This laptop has been built that such that without the charger plugged in (AC INPUT), the CPU is slowed (throttled) to 400 Mhz. Basically rendering this laptop useless without a charger. Not even Windows 7 will run on this without a charger.You cannot override this setting as it is at the chip level.They have also instituted h2O Bios, where we have limited control over the product.For a country like India where the power can leave at any point.This product is useless without a constant power supply.This is a poor build, and it seems like ACER lazily reapplied some chip settings they had designed for another product on this one without any quality checks.
